title: Store Manager in Training Plaza 35
description:
**Company Description**  

As the global leader in health and wellness innovation since 1935, GNC motivates people to reach their goals with the most trusted and exciting selection of products in the industry.


As #TeamGNC, we work hard to ensure that our consumers come first. We are always cultivating and collaborating on new ideas to bring innovative solutions to the forefront and testing new solutions to translate goals into action. Our team members are advocates for change and innovation.


There is no greater gift than good health and no greater satisfaction than helping others to achieve it. Be a part of helping others to Live Well!

 **Job Description** **POSITION SUMMARY:**

Responsible for learning the overall operations of a retail store under the direction of a Store Manager/Head Coach or District Manager. Gains knowledge and competency in financial processes required to manage a retail store.


Under guidance from supervisors has gained full proficiency in managerial responsibilities within 90-day timeframe. Available and willing to take SM responsibilities within local market (30 miles/30 minutes) if/when offered.

 **JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Facilitates an exceptional customer service experience through all channels of interaction by following GNC’s prescribed selling methods; meets or exceeds all corporate set goals, expectation, and key performance indicators
* Drives GNC’s loyalty programs and incentives for successful engagement of customers
* Monitors best sellers, identifies product demand, and updates SM regarding trends
* Facilitates community engagement and client loyalty through innovative and creative outreach
* Reads all merchandising bulletins to understand product assortment and answer product questions based on Company approved information
* Supervises and leads store team under SM guidance; communicates sales targets and drives team performance; provides feedback and supports succession planning of high performers by communicating team performance to SM
* Reviews all training resources and complete assigned modules to understand product assortment and answer product questions based on Company approved information
* Ensures company assets are protected and not exposed to risks and conflicts of interest
* Partners with SM to handle escalated customer service issues; supports SM in monitoring store’s Loss Prevention activities and escalates concern
* Keeps store clean and uncluttered
* Perform all register operations. Complete all daily register and store open/close functions and bank deposits according to GNC policies and procedures

 **Learns to independently**:

* Lead staffing and training initiatives
* Manage work schedules within established budgets for optimal store coverage
* Hire, train, and discipline employees
* Implement planograms and the Visual Playbook in an accurate and timely manner, ensuring GNC's standard of store presentation
* Manage store inventory within GNC guidelines: receive, check, and shelve all merchandise orders in support of the customer experience in store, as well as for omni-channel customers being serviced through Buy Online Pickup in Store or Ship from Store
* Adhere to GNC's quality control program for stock rotation, infestation control, outside inspections and all maintenance problems; including but not limited to regularly performing Product Cleaning and Rotation, for reviewing and addressing expiration dates, and adjusting on-hands
* Ensure total compliance for all store operations policies; ensuring execution of omni-channel initiatives including product subscriptions (Routines), Ship from Store and Buy Online Pickup in Store.
* Independently performs complex duties, including but not limited to people management, store operations, inventory management, merchandising, loss prevention, selling and leading others in selling skills development
* Additional duties as assigned

 **SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Responsible for supervising a team of employees.

 **PHYSICAL ASPECTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:** (For all JDs; Adjust as needed based on job requirements)

* Regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands or fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk or hear.
* Regularly/Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
* The noise level in the work environment is usually low/moderate.
* *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.*

 **Qualifications**  

* Minimum high school diploma required or associate degree in business or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key accountabilities of the job required.
* 2+ years of retail sales experience and prior management/supervisory experience preferred
* High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications
* Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning)
* Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as internal and external clients
* Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
* Ability to work with and influence subordinates, peers, and senior management
* Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines, high sense of urgency and reporting
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals; ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
* Ability to read, write, and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos
* Ability to work overtime as necessary
* Must be available to work evenings, weekends, and holidays
* Must have current driver’s license.

**BENEFITS**


The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

* Access to GNC Health Program (virtual health services).
* Competitive rate of pay.
* Employee discount
* This position is eligible to participate in the Individual Sales Commission Program

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Base Hourly Rate: $17.00 to $18.50 per hour  

  

The base hourly rate range represents the low and high end of the anticipated hourly rate range. The actual hourly rate offered for this position depends on several factors including knowledge, skills, experience, and location. Our base hourly rate is one component of GNC’s competitive total rewards strategy.


The compensation and benefits information are accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.


GNC Holdings, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer


GNC Holdings LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Certified Home Health Aide (HHA)
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a compassionate Home Health Aide to provide essential assistance to clients in their homes. The ideal candidate will support individuals with daily tasks, personal care, and companionship, promoting their overall well-being.

Duties:  
- Assist clients with personal care activities such as bathing, grooming, and dressing  
- Prepare and serve nutritious meals according to dietary needs  
- Provide medication reminders and assist with medication management  
- Perform light housekeeping tasks to maintain a clean and safe environment  
- Engage clients in meaningful activities and provide emotional support  
- Accompany clients to medical appointments and community outings

Qualifications:  
- Experience in meal preparation and cooking for diverse dietary requirements  
- Knowledge of medical terminology and familiarity with HIPAA regulations  
- Previous experience in home community care, senior care, or assisted living preferred  
- Ability to work with individuals with developmental disabilities and provide hospice care  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively within healthcare systems

This position offers the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of others while gaining valuable experience in the healthcare field. If you are dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for those in need, we welcome you to apply for this rewarding role.

title: Temp Customer Service Representative
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Customer Care Coordinator position acts as a primary support for the Customer Care Team. You will have the ability to accompany and welcome new customers while supporting on research and organization of day-to-day functions.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

· **File and submit FedEx claims**: Process and submit claims with FedEx for any damaged, lost, or delayed shipments, ensuring timely resolution and reimbursement.

· **Update cross-functional collaboration communication**: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of customer interactions, feedback, and resolutions, and share relevant information with other departments for seamless collaboration.

· **Send Welcome communication to new customers**: Reach out to new customers with personalized welcome communications, providing essential information about our products or services and ensuring a smooth customer journey.

· **Send Customer Surveys**: Distribute customer satisfaction surveys to gather feedback on our products, services, and overall customer experience. Share survey responses to identify areas for improvement.

· **Coordinate Customer Research Responses**: Act as the main point of contact for customer research initiatives, collect responses from customers, organize data, and collaborate with internal teams to address customer concerns ensuring efficient workflow and timely completion of customer care activities

· **Process Ecommerce Returns:** Handle all aspects of ecommerce returns and issuing refunds through Salesforce.

· **Track and Update Connected Trade-Ins**: Maintain and update accurate records of CW trade-in requests to track pending and completed transactions.

· **Shift:** Monday to Friday 9:00am to 6:00pm.

· **TEMP Position**: from **June** **22nd- September 27th** **2024**

· **PAY:** $20/hr

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**

* Maintaining a positive, compassionate, and professional demeanor towards clients at all times.
* Champion a problem-solving approach.
* Awareness of technology and technical products
* Excellent written/verbal and follow-up/time management skills
* Proficient in MS Word, Outlook, Excel, Power Point is required. Relevant SAP and Salesforce experience preferred.
* Ability to quickly learn a database computer program required
* Ability to adeptly multitask and prioritize as necessary with strong attention to detail
* Open to constructive feedback to improve their own performance and to enhance the overall performance of the team
* Fluent in English (Spanish a plus!)

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

* High school graduate or GED required

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Springfield, NJ 07081

title: BCBA - Full Time Salary - School
description:
\\_ **GBS is looking for a BCBA for school cases in Paterson NJ. M-F, Daytime.**\\_

* Conduct initial and concurrent assessments and develop individualized treatment plans every six months.
* Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments and develop Behavior Intervention Plans during the initial assessment or at the onset of problem behavior.
* Review treatment plans and behavior intervention plans with the client’s parent/caregiver before initiating.
* Conduct data analysis, update goals and objectives, data sheets, and bring instructional materials to the clients session weekly.
* Check Graham Behavior Services email address weekly.
* Train behavior therapists on skill acquisition programs and behavior intervention plans.
* Provide instructional materials needed for therapy.
* Schedule monthly clinics with family, therapists, and director as needed.
* Provide parents and caregivers with training on Applied Behavior Analysis.
* Assist caregivers with IEPs, evaluations by other service providers, understanding of autism, Applied Behavior Analysis, and special education.
* Coordinate care between school, home, and other service providers.
* Monitors children for signs of child abuse, and reports incidents of suspected abuse to appropriate personnel immediately.
* When possible provide direct services to clients if behavior therapist are unable.
* Inform Director of any problems or concerns with staff, clients, client’s family, and systems or procedures used by Graham Behavior Services.
* Assist Director in conducting annual evaluations of behavior therapists.
* Maintain open communication with parents and behavior therapists including scheduling home programming.
* Alert Director if scheduling problems arise that cannot be resolved.
* Supervise BCBA, BCaBa, and RBT candidates at BCBA’s discretion.
* Attends meetings, events, trainings, workshops, and seminars as required by Graham Behavior Services.
* Maintains advanced working knowledge of early childhood education and development practices and standards, and principles of applied behavioral analysis.
* Consistently demonstrates a high level of integrity, responsibility, accountability, teamwork and ethics.
* Adheres to all policies, procedures and standard practices of Graham Behavior Services.

title: Mobile Phlebotomist
description:
Mobile Clinical & Life Insurance Phlebotomist

APPS Paramedical is the nation’s largest and most technologically advanced health

information provider. Our network of health professionals conducts physical

examinations, testing, and personal health interviews, primarily for the life insurance

industry.

We are looking for dependable, detail-oriented medical professionals (RN's, LPN's,

Certified MA, Phlebotomist, EMT’s & Paramedics) to work flexible hours, part- and full-

time opportunities available.

Responsibilities may include:

 Performing mobile paramedical exams (health history, vitals, obtain and

complete specimens (blood, urine, etc.), and may complete ECG tracings (ECG's

not available in all areas; the local office will determine this need).

 The ability to schedule your own hours; you tell us when you are available to

assist with cases.

 Must have strong and continued communication with the branch office regarding

case status.

Qualified candidates must have:

 Current Certificate of Phlebotomy training, as required by your state, for

completion of phlebotomy services.

 Minimum of 2 years of current phlebotomy experience preferred and completed a

minimum of 100 successful draws, valid driver’s license, and own transportation

with valid insurance.

 The position requires excellent communication, organization, and technical skills:

the interpersonal skills to interface extensively with clients, management, and

office staff, as well as a high level of courtesy, tact, and professionalism.

 The candidate must also have a computer, printer, cell phone.

Compensation:

 Fixed compensation per case completed. Paid on a case-by-case basis. The

hourly price range posted is based on our two frequently requested requirements

for a case. Hourly price range $25 - $30

Bi-lingual speakers are a plus!

APPS is looking for quality medical professionals to help us complete our exams in a timely,

professional manner on behalf of the insurance company the policy is being applied through.

Job Summary: Our Examiners need to be self-motivated, detail oriented, organized, and able to

complete quality exams.

Hours: • Set your own schedule! We offer exams 7 days a week and 52 weeks of the year. We

schedule your appointments for you, so you get to focus on what you do best…medical exams!

Qualifications: • Minimum 2 years of phlebotomy experience preferred, as well as familiarity with

taking vital signs. • Familiarity

title: Hotel General Manager (Relocate to Peoria, IL)
description:
**GENERAL MANAGER**

**Job Description**

Shreem Capital, a trailblazer in the hotel industry, is actively seeking a dynamic and experienced Hotel General Manager. The Hotel General Manager is the captain of the ship, overseeing all aspects of the hotel's operation to ensure its success. This leadership role requires a blend of business acumen, hospitality expertise, and interpersonal skills.

**SUMMARY:**

* **Leadership and Strategy:**
* Provide vision, direction, and motivation to inspire staff to deliver exceptional guest service.
* Collaborate with department heads to set goals, develop strategies, and achieve overall hotel objectives.
* **Financial Performance:**
* Develop and implement strategies to maximize revenue, profitability, and cost-efficiency.
* Create and manage budgets, balancing costs with guest satisfaction and service quality.
* Monitor financial performance and identify areas for improvement.
* **Sales and Marketing:**
* Lead the hotel's sales and marketing efforts, developing targeted strategies to attract guests.
* Stay current on industry trends and implement best practices to boost occupancy rates.
* Foster relationships with travel agents, tour operators, and corporate clients.
* **Guest Service:**
* Ensure the delivery of exceptional guest service that exceeds expectations.
* Address guest concerns and complaints promptly and professionally.
* Maintain high standards for guest satisfaction through ongoing quality control measures.
* **Operations and Maintenance:**
* Oversee the overall maintenance and upkeep of the hotel facilities and equipment.
* Implement procedures to ensure safety, security, and hygiene standards.
* Manage guest amenities and ensure their proper functioning.
* **Other Responsibilities:**
* Maintain positive relationships with vendors and other stakeholders.
* Stay informed of industry trends and developments.
* Comply with all relevant laws, regulations, and licensing requirements.

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

* Extensive experience in the hotel industry, preferably in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of success in achieving financial targets and revenue growth.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and inspire staff.
* Excellent communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* In-depth knowledge of hospitality operations, sales, and marketing.
* Proficiency in hotel management, Marriott software and financial systems.
* A bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or 5 years in related field is preferred.

**PERFORMANCE STANDARDS**

* **Guest Experience:** The GM sets the standards for guest service and ensures every department works together to create a positive and memorable experience for guests. This involves addressing guest concerns, ensuring cleanliness and comfort of the facilities, and keeping a pulse on guest satisfaction.
* **Guest Satisfaction Scores:** Metrics like online reviews and guest surveys provide valuable feedback on how well the hotel is meeting expectations.
* **Reputation Management:** A general manager needs to address guest concerns promptly and effectively, minimizing negative feedback and protecting the hotel's reputation.
* **Financial Performance:** The GM is accountable for the hotel's financial health. They manage budgets, control costs, and develop strategies to maximize revenue. This involves tasks like revenue management, setting sales targets, and analyzing financial data.
* **Staff Management:** The GM leads and motivates the hotel staff. They oversee all departments, from housekeeping and front office to food service and maintenance.
* **Revenue Management:** A GM is expected to oversee strategies to maximize revenue, like setting room rates and managing occupancy. This includes keeping an eye on industry trends and competitor pricing.
* **Cost Control:** Keeping expenses in check is crucial. The GM needs to develop budgets and find ways to optimize operational efficiency.
* **Profitability:** Ultimately, the hotel needs to be profitable. The GM is accountable for delivering a healthy financial return on the investment.
* **Team Management:** The GM leads a large team across various departments. They need to be effective at motivating staff, fostering a positive work environment, and promoting teamwork.
* **Employee Satisfaction:** Happy employees provide better service. The GM should create a work culture that values staff and reduces turnover.
* **Communication:** Clear and consistent communication is essential. The GM needs to keep staff informed, listen to their concerns, and delegate tasks effectively.
* **Industry Awareness:** Staying informed about industry trends, best practices, and legal requirements is important for effective decision-making

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* **Standing and walking for long periods:** This is a big part of the job. Hotel General Managers are constantly on the move, checking on different areas of the hotel, meeting with staff and guests.
* **Flexible work hours:** The hospitality industry never sleeps, and neither does a Hotel General Manager. Expect to work evenings, weekends, and be on call sometimes.

Overall, it's more about stamina and endurance than strength. You'll need to be able to keep up with a fast-paced environment.

Shreem Capital is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants who resonate with our culture of radical honesty and transparency.

title: Operations Business Consultant
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)

POSITION SCOPE: Operating within the guidelines of normal Master Policies and Procedures, the Operations Business Consultant is responsible for overseeing the accounts as it relates to the Regional Franchise Development Owner. The Operations Business Consultant inspects accounts, engages in proactive visits of accounts, coordinates site visits and new accounts orientation, resolves customer complaints, develops, conducts training classes for CBO and maintains the network of CBO.  

  

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:  

  

* Represents the Jan-Pro brand with vigor and enthusiasm

  

  

* Inspects accounts at the rate of once per month on accounts valued at more than $700 and once per quarter on accounts value at less than $700

  

  

* Accompanies CBO and Operations Representative in ‘proactive’ site visits

  

  

* Calls new accounts within 24 hours of receiving notice of new customer

  

  

* Meets with new contacts to establish relationship

  

  

* Performs initial assessment via ‘walk-through’ of new potential CBO

  

  

* Sets up new accounts and provide assistance in the ‘new accounts’ process

  

  

* Provides ‘on-site’ training for new CBO and complete new CBO paperwork

  

  

* Identifies Special Service work opportunities for CBO

  

  

* Reviews customer needs for consumable supply needs

  

  

* Resolves customer complaints as necessary

  

  

* Assists the Regional Franchise Development Owner in preparation and delivery of the Initial CBO training and growing their business

  

  

* Transfers customers between owners if requested and documents these requests and transfers

  

  

* Informs all owners of transfers and assists in the transfer process through walk-throughs and information exchange

  

  

* Attempts resolution of customer complaints

  

  

* Recommends solutions for Owners in situations where customers are considering cancelling accounts

  

  

PREREQUISITE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EDUCATION:  

  

* Minimum of 2 years in customer service experience

  

  

* Ability to speak and write in Spanish is an advantage.

  

  

* Demonstrated ability to manage large teams of people in organized structure.

  

  

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.

  

  

* Proficient in MS Office programs (Word, Power Point, Excel, and Outlook) and Internet operations.

  

  

* Strong presentation skills.

  

  

* Professional speaking voice and demeanor.

  

  

* Ability to work highly sensitive information and work in a confidential environment.

  

  

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS:  

  

* Ability to function in high-pressure situations

  

  

* Manual dexterity to operate a computer (desk-top and lap-top) and other electronic equipment

  

  

* Ability to take legible hand-written notes where necessary

  

  

* Correctable vision and hearing

  

  

* Excellent interpersonal skills

  

  

* Clear, easy to understand oral communication ability

  

  

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive and the employee will also perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned by immediate supervisor and other management as required. The Company reserves the right to revise or change duties as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.

title: Rental Sales Agent
description:
**Job Description** **Come Join the SIXT Battery Park Team. Rental Sales Agent $22.80/hr. Plus Monthly Bonus. The average Rental Sales Agent Monthly Bonus ranges $1,000-$2,500 monthly.**

**Hiring Rental Sales Agent - Retail Sales, B2B, Hospitality Sales, Banking Sales, Car Rental Sales.**


Join our team as a Rental Sales Agent and embark on a role where you’ll thrive on sales opportunities and deliver top-notch customer experiences. Your main goal is to exceed customer expectations by not only meeting their rental needs but also introducing them to additional products and services that enhance their journey.

**What you’ll do to excel:**

* Elevate every rental experience by actively promoting and selling additional vehicles and optional extras that align with each customer’s preferences.
* Provide exceptional customer service throughout all customer interactions, ensuring satisfaction and building loyalty.
* Achieve sales targets and uphold service standards to contribute to our team’s success.
* Execute administrative duties, including maintaining daily checklists to support smooth branch operations.
* Communicate effectively via phone and email, embodying our commitment to friendly and helpful service.
* Collaborate with the branch team to efficiently manage vehicle returns and ensure swift turnaround times.
* Embrace other assigned responsibilities as needed to support our dynamic business environment.
* Meet and exceed sales targets, which is a fundamental requirement of this role.
* Exceptional interpersonal and relationship building skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to multi-task
* Ability to manage stressful or unusual situations grace and enthusiasm to maintain good customer service

**What you will do:**

* Prepare the rental agreement while advising on and up-selling vehicles and optional extras to the customer according to their needs
* Provide excellent customer service in all customer contact situations
* Meet all sales and service standards
* Complete administrative tasks including daily lists to assist the branch
* Communicate via telephone and email in a friendly and helpful manner
* Assist branch with returning and turnaround of vehicles as needed
* Perform other job duties as assigned to meet the business needs

  

**Qualifications** **About you:**

* High school diploma or GED
* Minimum 1-year customer service or sales experience
* Must be at least 18 years old and have a valid driver's license with a clean driving record
* Experience meeting sales quotas or working in highly commissioned positions preferred
* Ability to follow defined service and sales processes
* Position likely to require at least 5-10% travel, some of which may be by airplane
* Must be willing to wear company uniforms
* Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
* Ability to communicate in other languages is a plus

  

**Additional Information** **Benefits:**


Paid vacation, medical, dental, vision and 401(k), Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Basic Life and Supplemental Life benefits and future growth opportunities within the company.


At Sixt, we pride ourselves on having an inclusive and unique environment. We are an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Men / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


The information listed above is intended to describe the general nature and level of this position. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. Your response to this advertisement may result in your consideration for employment with Sixt Rent a Car, LLC and its subsidiaries. Offers of employment will be made by Sixt rent a Car, LLC or any of its subsidiaries or brands.


Are you ready to get behind the wheel of an exciting career? Come join our team! Apply now.

**About the department:**  

As a mobility service provider, our Branches & Operations division is the point of contact with our customers: whether by phone, app or directly in our SIXT branches. This means: premium service directly to the customer, advice and sales in exchange and responsibility for the rental process of our premium fleet. As part of a team, it is easier to explain our products, find the best solution for the customer and manage the day-to-day business.


**About us:**  

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!
company_description: We are one of the world’s leading mobility service providers with sales of close to EUR 3.07 billion and 7,500 employees worldwide.

description:
Hand and Stone Massage and Facial Spa in Staten Island, NY is currently seeking a sales focused Assistant Spa Manager to help us drive our spa operations!  

  

The position of Assistant Spa Manager is designed for people who are passionate about client interactions, interested in learning about the wellness industry and expanding their sales experience.  

  

**Ideal candidates for this role demonstrate the following attributes:**  

  

  

  

* **Growth Focused Leadership -** the assistant spa manager will be running the front desk of the spa, training sales associates, and working closely with our spa managers to produce both a client and team focused culture..
* **Member Conversion and Customer Service**-As part of the spa management team, you will lead by example. You enjoy connecting with clients to offer them individualized sales solutions. You also understand how to coach and motivate a sales team.
* **Promote Health and Wellness** – You understand, or want to learn more, about the benefits of massages and facials. You are comfortable educating members and guests on services, upgrades, products, and memberships.
* **Multi-Tasking Expertise** Have experience handling or assisting with administrative tasks- including (but not limited to) payroll, scheduling, inventory management, and sales reporting.
* **Passion to Drive Results** – You understand the impact of your actions and flex your strategy to drive results accommodate the needs of the business. are available a variety of business hours including evenings and weekends.

title: Entry Level Technician - Starting 09/30 in Glen Gardner, NJ
description:
**Kickstart Your Career with MasTec Advanced Technologies**

**COMPANY VEHICLE AND FUEL CARD PROVIDED!**

Are you looking to level up your technical know-how and customer service skills? At MasTec Advanced Technologies, your expertise is not only appreciated—it’s vital. We offer you the opportunity to work with the latest in home technology, from satellite installations to smart home systems, where you’ll become the trusted technician that customers depend on.

**TRAINING PAY:** $20 per hour | **Training Begins:** September 30th

**Why Work with MasTec Advanced Technologies?**

Join our energetic Home Installation team in partnership with a leading Satellite provider. You’ll play a key role in installing and maintaining satellite systems, ensuring a seamless and professional experience for every customer, while always keeping safety first. Your day-to-day responsibilities will involve both indoor and outdoor tasks across various customer sites.

If you’re ready to move your career forward, we’re excited to meet you.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* A customer service pro who sets high standards.
* A tech enthusiast eager to stay updated with the latest innovations.
* A self-motivated individual who can handle multiple responsibilities efficiently.
* A problem-solver dedicated to providing customers with top-notch solutions.
* A committed learner who thrives on staying ahead in the tech world.

**What We Offer:**

* **Competitive Pay:** Performance-based earnings and the potential to earn even more.
* **Comprehensive Training:** Paid training covering safety protocols, technology, customer service, and sales techniques.
* **Employee Perks:** Discounts on DIRECTV, high-quality tools, uniforms, a company vehicle, and a fuel card.
* **Health Coverage:** Medical, dental, and vision plans, plus a 401(k) with company matching and an employee stock purchase plan.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Paid time off and flexible scheduling options to support your lifestyle.
* **Career Advancement:** Clear paths for promotion, with 80% of our Operations Managers having started as Technicians.
* **Earning Potential:** The opportunity to make up to $22 per hour or more based on performance.

**Basic Requirements:**

* Ability to climb ladders and strictly follow safety guidelines.
* Physical capability to lift 60-80 pounds and work on ladders up to 36 feet.
* Willingness to work in a variety of environments, both indoors and outdoors, regardless of weather conditions.
* Ability to perform physical tasks like kneeling, crawling, and bending.
* A valid driver’s license is required.
* Flexibility to work varied schedules, including weekends and evenings.
* A strong commitment to following all safety protocols.
* Willingness to travel to Edison, NJ for training (with hotel and expenses covered for eligible candidates).

**About Us:**

MasTec Advanced Technologies is a leader in last-mile fulfillment services, specializing in deploying and installing advanced technology solutions. We support a broad range of consumer and commercial products, delivering exceptional customer experiences every time. With a nationwide team of over 2,000 professionals and technicians, we connect people with the technology they need—from entertainment systems to smart home solutions. With over 25 years of experience, we’re your trusted partner in planning, staffing, training, and deployment of resources.

Ready to take the next big step in your career? Join us at MasTec Advanced Technologies!

(DG)

The average earnings for a technician in this role are estimated at $22-$26 per hour for reference purposes, but the payment structure is fixed and NON-NEGOTIABLE. This is a full-time, permanent and W2 position. Please just answer with YES or NO.

* Greet and welcome guests and respond to their requests in a courteous and friendly manner.

* Quickly remove dishes as guests finish each meal at the end of each meal or function.
* Abide by all corporate act, laws and requirements pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages.
* Replenish beverages when necessary, and check with guests to make sure they are satisfied.
* After the banquet, reset banquet room in accordance with the supervisor’s specifications to ensure the readiness of the room for other functions.
* Follow attendance rules and always go to work on a regular basis.
* Perform other related functions that may be assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Hospitality experience preferred.
* Must be willing to relate cordially with other members of the team and help co-workers with their job duties.
* Must have basic knowledge of service standards, guest relations, food and beverage preparations as well as etiquette.

**The Company:** Lessing’s Hospitality Group is comprised of over 100 locations throughout the Northeast and Florida. Lessing’s operates 20 wedding and catering venues, 20 full-service restaurants, 2 pop-up kitchen concepts, over 60 corporate and academic dining centers, and a historic inn. Steeped in over 130 years of tradition, but adapting to a constantly changing industry, Lessing’s Hospitality Group’s focus is on providing each guest with unique, personalized experiences and remarkable hospitality.

title: Assistant Collections Manager
description:
**Position Title:** Assistant Collections Manager

Advanced Recovery Group is seeking a skilled Assistant Collections Manager to support the manager in leading a team of collection agents. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication and organizational abilities, as well as a solid understanding of payment processing. If you're someone who brings innovative ideas and fresh strategies to enhance team performance, ARG could be the perfect fit for you!

**Company:** 

Advanced Recovery Group (ARG) functions as a comprehensive collection agency, providing efficient management solutions with professionalism and effectiveness. Positioned to lead in the commercial collections industry, ARG is dedicated to delivering exemplary service to financing entities throughout the US.

**Benefits and Perks:** 

**-** Comprehensive Compensation

o Salary Range: $60k-$70k

o plus, monthly commission

**-** Medical/ Dental/ Vision/ Life/ Disability/ 401 (k) Benefits Packages for individuals

**-** Paid Time Off after 90 Day Review & 13 Paid Holidays

**-** Quarterly Team Building Outings

**-** Weekly Sponsored Lunches

**-** Valuable Inclusive Work Environment

**Role Description:** 

Responsibilities:

**-** Assist in managing and leading the collections team, ensuring smooth daily operations and achieving performance goals.

**-** Oversee and manage the processing of payments, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with company procedures.

**-** Prepare and maintain reports, forms, and documentation using Microsoft Word and other office software to track collections, payment records, and team performance.

**-** Assist in training, mentoring, and guiding collection agents, providing feedback and addressing performance issues as needed.

**-** Collaborate with the manager to implement innovative strategies to improve collection rates and streamline workflows.

**-** Handle various administrative tasks such as scheduling meetings, organizing documents, and supporting the manager with any additional tasks or projects.

**-** Assist in resolving complex or escalated collection cases by communicating with customers and negotiating payment arrangements.

Requirements:

**-** Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with being highly organized and detail oriented.

**-** Advanced computer skills, including familiarity with collections platforms, MS Office Suite, and Excel.

**-** Capacity to manage large volumes of data with an analytical mindset with problem solving abilities.

**-** Willingness to occasionally work overtime.

**Company Culture:** 

At Advanced Recovery Group (ARG), our company culture is deeply rooted in dedication, professionalism, and innovation. We foster an environment that encourages collaboration and empowers individuals to bring forth their unique perspectives and ideas. With a focus on excellence in service delivery, we prioritize continuous improvement and learning, ensuring that our team stays ahead in the dynamic landscape of financial services. At ARG, we value diversity and inclusivity, recognizing the strength that comes from embracing varied backgrounds and experiences. Together, we strive to create a supportive and rewarding work environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success.

**Your Background:** 

**-** 2+ years of experience in collections or a related field, with experience in payment processing and team support.

**-** Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance

**-** North Jersey Based/ In office position.

title: Door to Door Sales Rep
description:
**Join Our Solar Sales Team – No Experience Required!**

Are you ready to kickstart an exciting career in solar sales, even with no prior experience? Organic Light, a black-owned solar sales company, is seeking driven individuals who are ready to learn, grow, and make a meaningful impact in the rapidly expanding solar industry. With government incentives, rebates, and tax credits, now is the perfect moment to educate homeowners on the transformative benefits of solar energy – and you can be at the forefront of this important movement.

**What You'll Do:**

- Learn & Grow: Our comprehensive training program will take you from zero solar experience to a successful solar sales professional in as little as 90 days. You’ll gain expert knowledge of the industry and the tools needed to thrive.

- Educate Homeowners: Engage with homeowners in the field, educate them about the many benefits of solar energy, and dispel common misconceptions. You’ll help them understand how solar can save money with no out-of-pocket costs.

- Qualify Solar Homes & Set Appointments: You’ll identify solar-viable homes, generate interest, and set appointments for our solar specialists to provide personalized consultations.

- Attend Training & Ride-Alongs: Gain hands-on experience by attending in-person training sessions and joining ride-alongs on prospective sales appointments.

- Build a Customer Network: Through referrals, networking, and your exceptional rapport-building skills, you’ll grow your client base.

**What We Offer:**

- High Earnings Potential: Start your career with a clear path to six-figure earnings. Solar Professionals employed with us can expect to make $100k–$150k annually, with top reps earning over $225k+.

- Uncapped Commission & Bonuses: With uncapped commission potential, the sky’s the limit for your income. Plus, you can earn up to $7,000 in bonus money over your first 7 weeks!

- Comprehensive Training: We provide industry-leading training and ongoing support to ensure you succeed.

- Flexible Hours & Supportive Team: Enjoy partially flexible working hours and a supportive team environment that values your success.

- Career Growth: As we expand, you'll have the opportunity to own and grow your own franchise in the thriving solar industry.

**What We’re Looking For:**

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build trust and rapport with homeowners. Bilingual abilities are a plus.

- A positive, professional demeanor and a strong work ethic.

- Eagerness to learn and apply new skills – a student mentality is key!

- Ability to work outdoors, walk long distances, and be comfortable working weekends

- Reliable transportation is preferred but not required, along with strong communication skills via phone, text, and email.

- A strong drive to succeed, and a sense of purpose.

**Why Join Us?**

- Be part of something bigger! Help lead the way towards a cleaner, more sustainable future.

- Work in one of the most exciting and rapidly growing industries with incredible earning potential.

- Enjoy the satisfaction of knowing you're making a difference by helping homeowners transition to solar and save money.

- Are you ready to start your solar journey and make an impact? Apply today to become a part of our high-performing solar sales team!

title: Business Analyst
description:
This in-person position is responsible for supporting the overall data strategy of the Business Intelligence & Analytics department. The position will contribute throughout the entire data analytics lifecycle, including data acquisition, data hygiene, reporting, analytical modeling, and business application. Additionally, the role will proactively find areas of opportunity to streamline internal processes, develop automation, and build scalable data solutions. A technical and analytical approach to problem solving, a critical thinking mindset and an ability to partner and communicate with other internal stakeholders will be key success factors for delivering creative and actionable business solutions.  

**Essential Responsibilities:**  

* Acquire, organize, analyze, and present data from ticket sales, merchandise sales, marketing campaigns, corporate partnership sales, stadium operations, loyalty programs, market research and various other business verticals
* Develop predictive, prescriptive and machine learning data models (e.g., fan clustering, marketing campaign analysis) to support audience activation, identify business risks, and drive business outcomes
* Curate targeted audience segments for marketing campaigns, while overseeing the approval process to ensure data accuracy and integrity throughout all stages of the campaign build
* Analyze fan interactions and behavior to implement fan journeys and design lookalike models
* Facilitate A/B testing implementation and analysis to optimize engagement and conversion
* Address ad-hoc data requests and projects as needed (e.g., campaign performance metrics, fan profiles)
* Use SQL queries to retrieve business information, respond to ad hoc requests and develop Business Intelligence dashboards in Power BI
* Design and develop internal systems and scripts in collaboration with our Data Engineer to acquire data that can be used to enhance and automate the business process

**Qualifications:**  

* 2 Years of experience in an analytical role
* A degree in a quantitative field, such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, or Economics
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases
* Considerable experience with data science tools (e.g., R, Python, SAS) to develop automation and predictive analysis
* Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment, maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines
* Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to clearly convey ideas and collaborate effectively amongst stakeholders, many of which function outside of the analytics space
* Experience using Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tools preferred
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, and other Office products
* Curious self-starter who learns new concepts quickly

**GENERAL INFORMATION** A background check will be conducted prior to the start of the position. The New York Jets are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender (including gender nonconformity, status as a transgender individual, gender identity or expression), pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, affectional orientation, marital status, civil union status, and domestic partnership status, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The New York Jets are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities.  

Consistent with our commitment to maintain a safe workplace, all new hires are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide verification of vaccination prior to their start date, unless they receive an approved exemption under applicable law. “Fully vaccinated” refers to at least two (2) weeks after the final dose on a two-dose vaccination series (Pfizer or Moderna) or at least two (2) weeks after a single-dose COVID-19 vaccination series (Johnson and Johnson). In accordance with CDC recommendations, we recommend all new hires and employees stay up to date with their COVID-19 vaccination. “Up to Date” currently means that a person has completed their primary COVID-19 vaccine series, plus a booster vaccine, if eligible. For more information please refer to the below CDC page:  

https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html

title: Ice Resurface Zamboni Driver
description:
**Ice Rink – (Ice Resurfacer & Zamboni)****Description:**  

This position is responsible for performing rink resurfacing at designated times and the maintenance of two ice rinks at the Aviator Sports and Events Center. This position works independently under general supervision of the Executive Director of Ice Operations and Facility Director.  

**Several schedules are open - Monday-Friday evenings (time varies between 4pm-12am), Saturday and Sunday daytime and evening shifts. Must be flexible with working evenings and weekends.**  

 **Essential Functions:*** Responsible for the maintenance of two ice surfaces and maintaining equipment in ideal working conditions including cross-cutting, edging, and flooding when needed.
* Complete daily ice forms which include ice depth, ice rink temperatures, and building conditions.
* Oversee the ice installation.
* Maintenance of the ice plant to ensure safety and responding to emergencies. Ensuring that ice surfaces produce ideal skating conditions.
* Assist with checking ice equipment to ensure building temperatures and humidity level are at the desired range for ideal ice conditions.
* Daily ice conditioning, Zamboni maintenance, edge conditioning, etc
* Train selected staff on driving the Zamboni ice resurfaces equipment.
* Organizing day-to-day operations of the ice rinks.
* Create ice rink schedule and service ice rinks.
* Repair ice rink equipment as needed.
* Provide staff daily ice rink maintenance schedule.
* Work with Director to set Aviator policy and procedures for the Ice Rinks.
* Obtain and maintain all relevant licenses and certifications.
* Require training on building systems.
* Work with the Director to facilitate a clean and friendly environment.
* On call as needed.


**Qualifications/Requirements:**  

Must be able to work evenings (through 11:45 pm) and weekend hours. Some scheduled shifts may include holidays. Must be able to perform multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, often independently. Able to lift 25-50 lbs without any limitations. Must have experience driving a Zamboni and working with facility equipment. US ICE RINK CERTIFICATION HELPFUL.  

*The base pay range for this position is an hourly rate $20 - $30 per hour. The determination of what a specific employee in this job classification is paid within the range depends on a number of factors, including, but not limited to, prior employment history/job-related knowledge, qualifications and skills, etc.*  

Please forward all resume/cover letters using the attached link or send directly to Aviator Sports & Events Center, Cheri Peters, Human Resources Director, Hangar 5, Floyd Bennett Field, Brooklyn, New York 11234. Office number (718) 758-7511  

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

PartnerDelivery Driver  
Brooklyn, NY

We are an Amazon Delivery Service Partner looking for smart, motivated, Step van experienced, and hardworking professionals to fill driver positions! If you enjoy solving problems, enjoy driving, and like great benefits (paid time off, healthcare, savings). Come join our growing family and read on!

**Description**

Amazon Delivery Service Partner for package delivery

1 -2 years delivery driver experience is needed!

Apply today to schedule your in-person interview with. We're making on the spot job offers! (All job offers are contingent on meeting eligibility requirements.)

**Responsibilities**

* Drive a delivery step van to drop off Amazon packages to customers within their community
* Work about 4-5 days a week, a working day is about 10 hours, One weekenday is mandatory.
* Follow strict safety standards on and off the road
* Interact with Amazon customers and the public in a professional and positive manner
* Use a smartphone to manage the delivery process
* Must accept text messages from Company managers and other authorized Company employees regarding your schedule, performance, and other Company matters on your cell phone

**We offer**

* Competitive compensation
* Employee benefits available
* Community interaction
* Every day is fun and different

**Must meet the following requirements**

* Must be at least 21+ years old
* Must have a valid driver's license within the state of employment
* Must be able to operate and navigate a delivery van, GVWR 10,000 lbs. or less
* Must be able to move boxes up to 50 lbs., with or without reasonable accommodation
* Must consent to a drug screening
* Must have good communication skills and the ability to work well with customers

**Delivery Associates / Duties & Responsibilities**

* Safely drive and operate a delivery vehicle at all times.
* Use a smartphone device for routing information, customer delivery information.

* Must be comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions.

Frequently asked questions

**Do you need a commercial driver's license (CDL)?**

NO, CDL is NOT required

**Can I choose how many hours I want to work every day?**

Delivery drivers are full-time jobs, requiring 40 hours a week. Part-time positions are available as well.

**Do I need to provide my vehicle?**

No, logistics will provide delivery vehicles.

**What is an Amazon delivery service partner?**

QDPP is an Amazon partner providing a small parcel package delivery capability to customers every day. As an employee of QDPP, you will work directly for us operating out of an Amazon delivery station located in Brooklyn, NY.

title: EFFC CASE WORKER
description:
**JOB TITLE: Case Planner**  

 **DEPARTMENT: Enhanced Family Foster Care**

  

**FUNCTION OF THE POSITION:** The Case Planner is responsible for working with the family to support safety, permanency, and well-being to all children and youth. The Case Planner works with the family to develop and support implementation of the service plan, address barriers, assess progress, and identify changes as needed to
  

achieve the goals.

  

**REPORTS TO**: Case Planning Supervisor

  

**SUPERVISES:** N/A  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Complete initial face-to-face contact with the child in the foster home within 2 business days.
* Adhering to SCO casework contact policies, the Case Planner will conduct ongoing face-to-face contacts with the child, parent, and foster parent on caseload assessing for safety and risk.
* Complete Foster Home Safety Checklists, Birth Parent Safety Checklists, Safety and Abuse Risk

Questionnaires, and Clothing Checklists during casework contacts on a monthly basis.
  

* Count and monitor medication and medication compliance.
* Complete ongoing documentation in Connections with 7 business days of the event date.
* Assess safety and risk as well as protective and promotive factors and collaborate with families to create safety plans.
* Work in partnership with the child/family to continuously identify their strengths, resources, and supports needed and engage families to actively participate in the development and assessment of their service plan.
* Make referrals for services for children and families, both internally and externally (i.e Health Homes Care Management, CFTSS, Preventive, and therapy).
* Work side-by-side with the foster parent and birthparent to support and provide treatment and crisis intervention to the child in their care.
* Collaborate with parent advocates and case aides to encourage and support parents in taking steps to address personal and/or family challenges so that their children and safely return home.
* Accompanying and supporting children and parents through various appointments including school,medical, and drug treatment, etc.
* Support families through the Public Assistance process, PATH process, and provide referrals, as needed.
* Engage parents and foster families in concurrent planning from the beginning of the case, and work with foster parents toward adoption or KinGAP as appropriate based on each child’s permanency goal.
* Attends all required trainings including Core Case Planning and TRIPP. Case Planners should be aware of any significant changes in the field and be willing to attend outside trainings, seminars, and workshops, as needed for professional development.
* Complete timely comprehensive Permanency Hearing reports and FASP’s regarding the status of the family’s action plan and progress towards permanency.
* Complete Interstate Compact for the Placement of Children (ICPC), emergency homestudies, and Termination of Parental Rights packets, as needed.
* Intervene in crisis situations to help the child and family stabilize.
* Reinforce foster parent trainings.
* Attend and testify in court appearances.
* Support and supervise family time between parents and children, as well as siblings and other significant resources. Provide transportation as needed.
* Within 30 days of placement, complete initial treatment plan.
* Attend all interdisciplinary team meetings and actively provide information regarding services being provided to the child.
* Fulfills duty of Mandated Reporter, which entails reporting any suspected instances of child abuse or maltreatment.
* Meet with Supervisor one-on-one on a consistent basis to discuss safety and permanency issues of caseload.
* Communicates and work effectively with SCO foster care support staff such as Case Planners, Fair Future Coaches, Education Specialists, Parent Advocates, Case Aides, and medical and mental health staff and with NYC Children’s Services, outside medical and mental health centers, schools, consultants, other SCO programs, and all other relevant parties.
* Adheres to SCO’s personnel policies.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
 **QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelor’s degree required, BSW or MSW preferred.
* Approved background clearances and fingerprinting are required.
* Excellent oral and written communication.
* Proficiency in computer skills, including Microsoft Office, Excel and Connections.
* Bilingual abilities are strongly encouraged.
* Valid NYS Driver License required
  

**In addition, all EFFC employees should possess the following characteristics:**  

* Be team players. Maintain a constructive, cooperative, and positive atmosphere.
* Demonstrate commitment to the Agency’s mission and values.
* Be able to empathize and provide quality services to children and families that have histories of chemical dependency, mental illness, neglect, physical, sexual and/or emotional abuse.
* Be willing to work closely with children, families, and staff from different cultural and religious backgrounds, as well as from varying socio-economic statuses.
* Work competently, compassionately and without judgment with individuals who may identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and/or may be in different stages of discovering or disclosing their sexual orientation or gender identity.
* Possess a strong belief in people’s ability to grow and change; forge a mutually respectful partnership with persons served and their families.
* Be flexible in their ability to work extended hours or irregular schedules in response to the program’s needs. Be willing to travel between the various EFFC offices and other agency sites, as required.
* Demonstrate an ability to set limits and maintain the helping role of practitioner, as well as to intervene

appropriately.  


*SCO Family of Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer*  

 *Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities*

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelors or better

#### **Licenses & Certifications**


Required* DRIVER'S LICENSE
company_description: Each year, SCO Family of Services helps 60,000 New Yorkers build a strong foundation for the future.

title: Registered Nurse (Full-Time, Red Bank)
description:
CPC Integrated Health is actively recruiting a registered nurse (RN) to join an interdisciplinary team in our Red Bank office. CPC is one of a small group of agencies in NJ that provides an integrated, holistic and one stop approach to care for those who experience significant mental health, substance use and physical health challenges. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a supportive peer group, enjoy a set schedule with primarily daytime hours, and make a meaningful impact in the lives of our clients. If you are looking for a collaborative environment with strong professional support, don't let this opportunity pass you by. Please review the job description and apply today to be a part of our team.

 **Position Summary:** CPC Integrated Health is an innovative leader in the provision of integrated care. A well-respected institution in Monmouth County, CPC provides care for over 13000 people a year and is well known as a safety-net agency whose mission is to provide equitable and excellent care in the communities we serve. As a member of an interdisciplinary team that includes medical, clinical, care management and peer support staff, the RN works collaboratively to provide a whole health/one stop approach to the treatment of mental health, substance use and primary care.




**Minimal Qualifications** include an associate degree and license to practice as an RN in NJ. Must have 1-2 years' experience working with adults who experience significant mental health and/or substance use disorders, preferably in a community or ambulatory setting. Must have strong communication, organizational, interpersonal and clinical skills. Must be empathetic, non-judgmental, and committed to providing evidence-based and client-centered care.


**Preferred Qualifications** include additional years' experience working with adults who experience serious and persistent mental illness and significant substance use disorders including those who have been treated with medications for SUD in settings such as emergency/crisis, partial care, or intensive outpatient programming.


**Primary Responsibilities**:


* Conduct assessments and participate in the development of individualized treatment plans as a member of an interdisciplinary team.


* Assess for signs and symptoms of psychiatric decompensation, relapse related to substance use or medical risk to determine need for emergency treatment including PRN and/or hospital screening.


* Provide support and education to clients and families on issues related to medication management, symptom relief and health promotion.


* Administer medications, including long term injectables, and monitor for side effects and response to treatment.


* Participate in team meetings, including high risk reviews, to assess progress and update treatment plans as needed.


* Maintain accurate and up to date data in client records in accordance with regulatory and agency standards.


* Support harm reduction, recovery-based and trauma-informed approaches to care.



**About Our Benefits**


CPC Integrated Health offers a comprehensive variety of benefits to promote health and financial security for you and your family:

* Competitive Salary
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision Plan Options
* Generous Paid Time Off (vacation, sick, personal)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (Health Care & Dependent Care)
* 403b Retirement Plan (Employer Match!)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement & Professional Development Opportunities
* Company Paid Life Insurance
* Company Paid Coverage for Accidental and Critical Illness
* Credit Union
* Discount offers for cell phone service, entertainment, travel, shopping, childcare and much more!
company_description: Founded in 1960 in Monmouth County, CPC provides mental health, substance use and special education services for children and adults.

title: Workers' Compensation Attorney
description:
Vecchione, Vecchione, Connors & Cano, LLP, is looking for a Workers' Compensation Attorney to join our dynamic and growing practice. MUST BE LICENSED TO PRACTICE IN NY. The Attorney will be required to handle both hearings and depositions. Experienced preferred.  

  

Ideal candidate is an initiative-taker with good analytical skills and will actively participate in all aspects of workers compensation case from start to finish and make virtual and/or in person appearances before the Workers Compensation Board.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

* Day-to-day handling of cases and depositions.
* Dictating and/or drafting correspondences to clients keeping them apprised of hearings and depositions results.
* Interactions with Witnesses to include telephone conferences.
* Guiding clients, when necessary, through the Workers' Compensation process.

**Qualifications:**  

  

* Law degree from a fully accredited law school.
* An active member in good standing with the New York State Bar Association. \\*\\*Pending admission to NYS Bar Association is acceptable.
* Workers' Compensation experience in New York is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Strong written and verbal skills.

Excellent growth and advancement opportunities.  

  

Please provide your resume, and if applicable include \\*\\*writing sample and \\*\\*transcripts.  

  

Compensation - DOE.  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Part Time or Per Diem Medical Assistant
description:
**Benefits/Perks**  

* Great small business work environment
* Flexible scheduling
* Paid time off, health insurance, dental insurance, retirement benefit, and more!

**Company Overview**  

American Family Care (AFC) is one of the largest primary and urgent care companies in the U.S. providing services seven days a week on a walk-in basis. Our state-of-the-art centers focus on the episodic treatment of acute illnesses and injuries, workers' compensation, and occupational medicine. Each location is equipped with an onsite lab and in-house x-ray capability.  

AFC is the parent company of AFC Franchising, LLC (AFCF). This position works directly with a franchised business location. The specific job duties and benefits can vary between franchises.  

  

**Job Summary**  

Provides general medical care under the direction of a licensed provider to patients in an outpatient clinic setting.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Obtain patient vitals, medical history, and reason for visit, and prepare the patient for a physical exam
* Explain prescribed procedures and treatments to patients
* Ensure all ordered tests are performed accurately and in a timely manner
* Administer prescribed medications and treatments in accordance with the approved procedure
* Draw blood and preparation labs for reference lab processing and/or in-house processing
* Perform laboratory tests, lab-quality controls, and equipment maintenance according to written instructions
* Respond to all lab messages and call back requests
* Perform all drug screening procedures in accordance with established rules and regulations
* Ensure patient immunizations are well documented and administered in accordance with the approved procedure
* Conduct physician referrals as well as service pre-certifications on an as-needed basis
* Prepare exam rooms; sterilize instruments, equipment, and supplies for procedures
* Maintain complete and accurate documentation
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

  

**Qualifications**  

Associates degree (A.A.) or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school; or six months to one-year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. AMT registered and AAMA Certified Medical Assistants are preferred.

title: Medical Receptionist/Medical Assistant
description:
**Company Description**  

Integrated Dermatology of NJ is one of the largest Dermatology groups. We are seeking a highly motivated, reliable, kind, and hard-working Medical Receptionist/Medical Assistant to join our growing practice! We specialize in general, surgical, cosmetic dermatology, and in Moh’s surgery procedures. We operate in a very fast paced environment, and it is going to take someone with multitasking skills and great organization.

 **Job Description**  

* Front desk includes registering and checking patients in/out, answering phones, scheduling appointments and checking insurance.
* Confirming patient’s appointments, checking referrals, insurance validations
* Recording patient medical histories, vitals, test results and other information for medical records while maintaining strict confidentiality
* Preparing treatment rooms for clinical examinations and assisting practitioners with medical and surgical procedures and other patient care.
* Sterilizing and preparing instruments.
* Delivering compassionate support, attention, and assistance to patients and families.
* Ensuring compliance with all health care regulations, including HIPAA and OSHA.
* Scribing notes for Practitioners
* Other clerical duties may include, but are not limited to, faxing, biologic prior authorizations, patient results phone calls, lab and surgical paperwork.

  

**Qualifications**  

* High level of professionalism
* Attention to detail with strong ability to multitask
* Strong customer service skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Knowledge of electronic medical health care record systems
* Excellent computer and phone skills

**Job Type:**

* Full-time 4-5 days
* Ability to be flexible to cover as needed greatly appreciated.
* Experience working for a healthcare practice or hospital.
* Dermatology experience is a plus.
* Experience in MOHS assistance is a plus.
* Experience with and knowledge of EMR.
* Experience in assisting with surgical procedures.

**Education:**

* High school diploma or equivalent (Required)

**Certifications/Licenses:**

* Medical Assistant Certification (Required)

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Integrated Dermatology and it's entities provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Wireless Sales Representative - AT&T
description:
With almost 2,000 AT&T stores coast-to coast, Prime Communications is AT&T's largest authorized wireless retailer in the United States, and we want you to join us as a Retail Sales Consultant!



A Retail Sales Consultant (RSC) is a **brand** ambassador to our extraordinarily large base of customers nationwide. **Our RSC associates** serve the customer by demonstrating AT&T's vast array of products, services and entertainment options, **by** offering them **personalized and valuable wireless, entertainment, and connectivity** solutions to **fit their ever-evolving lifestyle** in a **fast-paced retail sales** industry.



Because we strive for the best, we offer amongst the best. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn a minimum base of ($25,000 + commission). Consultants could earn an average of $45,000 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals in the first year. Commission is based on meeting outlined sales goals for a given market.



You'll also be eligible for some or all of our amazing Benefits Packages, such as:


* We offer New Hire Ramp Up Bonus payments for the first three months
* Training and Opportunity to grow
* Supportive team environment
* Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and more


Not to mention some pretty cool perks such as:


* Latest devices and discounts on wireless service plans
* Using our technology, gain first-hand expertise to share with our customers
* Discounts on accessories and additional AT&T products and services, meaning you will always have access to the latest gadgets around


Dedication is always a good predictor of success at Prime Communications. Most Store Managers, were once RSCs, most District Managers were once Store Managers, etc. Join the community and forge your own sales path today!


* Provide extraordinary customer service by being compassionate towards and understanding their needs
* Build value by offering tailored and thoughtful solutions to fit each person, family or business
* Represent our Company and the AT&T brand with the utmost professionalism and courtesy
* Assist our leaders with store operations and duties
* Cooperate with your fellow RSCs to achieve a team approach to sales and customer service
* Achieve sales benchmarks and milestones (which can lead to that much needed extra bonus payment)
* Excel in selling AT&T's products/services, including entertainment, as we are a full-service lifestyle solution
* Work with wireless leaders to stand out, serve and succeed within the local community

Requirements:
**Requirements**


* Clear communication skills

Attitude and technical aptitude * - having an entrepreneurial spirit speaks volumes  

Commitment to exemplary customer service, honesty and integrity
* Background in retail sales is helpful, but not required
* At least 18 years old and legally able to work in the United States without restrictions.
* Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* Strong Social Media presence preferred
* Must have reliable transportation to location, off-site trainings, and meetings.
* Must live within 30 minutes of home store location with flexibility to work at multiple locations within a district as needed.
* Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax.
* Adhere to Team Color policy while maintaining neat and professional appearance.


**Working Conditions**


* Ability to lift up to 10 pounds.
* Ability to bend, squat and stretch for purposes of inventory and stocking.
* Requirement to stand for long periods of time in order to provide the best customer service (with or without a reasonable accommodation).
* Ability to work in fast pace environment.
* Ability to follow instructions to completion.
* Ability to work under pressure, multi-task and handle customer complaints or requests.
* Ability to adapt to fluctuating noise levels and varied sounds from multiple media sources/devices.
* Problem solves under pressure.  

	+ Job Type: Full-time
	+ Pay: $40,000.00-$50,000.00
	+ Shift: 8 hour shift
	+ Weekly day range: Weekend availability
company_description: Founded in 1999 with a single mall kiosk at Baybrook Mall in Houston, we are proud to represent AT&T as their largest Authorized Retailer in the United States with over 2,000 AT&T store locations.
