title: Foreign Medical Graduate/International Medical Graduate - Bilingual (English/Russian) Required
description:
**About us**

JASA is the go-to agency serving older adults in New York City, providing critical services to over 40,000 people annually. Founded 50+ years ago, JASA is a leading expert and innovator in aging services that recognizes the diversity among the aging population and honors older adults as vital members of society.

JASA’s life-changing support services, interventions and partnerships promote aging with a purpose and provide autonomy for older adults to remain in their homes and communities. JASA operates ten affordable housing properties, is a licensed home care agency and offers a breadth of integrative services citywide spanning free legal services, health and mental health services, home- delivered meals, social programming at senior centers and community trainings on elder abuse, peer health support, caregiver assistance and more.

- Upcoming position -

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

JASA’s Care Transitions Specialist (CTS) will coordinate, screen and facilitate the provision of home and community based support services to improve hospital to home care transitions to avoid preventable 30-day readmissions and other preventable hospitalizations. The CTS, an International Medical Graduate, must be bilingual (English/Russian) and have the capacity to work across home, community and clinical settings.

The Care Transitions Specialist will conduct in-home assessments with the following objectives:

* Develop community-based service plan
* Identify home-based issues that may be linked to readmission risk
* Provide direct services and referrals to support stable home based functioning, focusing on:
* Medication/DME (other supplies): Ensure patient has medication, supplies and equipment and understands prescribed use
* Patient Education: Ensure patient is aware of their health conditions and how to manage them, and understands red flags and health risks
* Health Care Provider Communication and Coordination: Ensure patient has a primary care provider (PCP), update PCP on patient status, assist patients with follow up appointments
* Screen for and identify social and mental health needs of patients and provide closed-loop referrals

This position will be responsible for:

* The provision In-Home and In-Office Assessment of the social and emotional needs of the older adult client and their family, utilizing prescribed standardized assessment instruments; securing where appropriate the assistance of other social work and/or other professional consultants.
* The development and implementation of a case plan for the provision of the full range of social services for the older adult client(s) and family, including:
* Education and support to improve disease self-management and prevent avoidable hospital use
* Screening of client eligibility, application for, and advocacy in securing benefits and entitlements
* The arrangement for direct provision of services such as transportation, homecare services, meals on wheels, public assistance, Medicare, Medicaid, emergency cash relief, legal aid, protective services, vocational placement, medical and psychiatric examination and therapy, housing, etc.
* Referral, development of relationships and cooperative work with other community agencies, to meet the needs of clients
* Informing supervisors of situations of crisis or circumstances where the worker requires further guidance.
* Participating in training and team meetings.
* Collecting and inputting patient data into JASA’s Electronic Health Record system and assisting with analytics, reports and statistics, utilizing computers.
* Performs such other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

* International Medical Graduate or equivalent.
* Good writing/record keeping skills.
* Ability to read, write, speak, understand English.
* Ability to read, write, speak, understand Russian.
* Must be computer literate, including ability to learn and use program-specific software.
* Ability to travel to clients' homes using mass transit and to negotiate any steps and barriers in clients' residences.
* Hospital discharge planning or other health care experience preferred.
* Understanding and appreciation of the roles of race, religion, ethnicity, sexual preference, and individual values as they relate to serving clients and families.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $52,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Language:

* English and Russian fluently (Required)

title: Math and English Assistants/Tutors for Kumon Learning Center
description:

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA/LBA)
description:
**About the Lighthouse:**

Lighthouse is a New York City-based specialized agency dedicated to providing top-quality Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy services for children with autism.

Our mission is to empower these children and their families by implementing evidence-based interventions that promote skill development, independence, and improved communication.

We value compassion, dedication, and professional growth, placing a strong focus on fostering a supportive environment where our team members can grow and thrive.

**Job Description:**

Lighthouse is seeking passionate and dedicated BCBA/LBAs to join our team of professionals.

As you build a relationship with children and their families, your work will directly contribute to their growth, development, and improved quality of life.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conducting functional behavior assessments and write reports summarizing results
* Develop positive behavior support plans
* Overseeing implementation of treatment plan
* Assist staff in day-to-day training for targeted behavioral needs and implementing behavior support plans
* Train staff to implement strategies to prevent occurrence of target behaviors and de-escalation strategies
* Provide ongoing monitoring of data and make programming adjustments as needed

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS**

**Qualifications:**

* Master’s Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) or related program
* Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
* LBA Certification
* Prefer minimum of one year working after BCBA certification
* Experience working with individuals with intellectual disabilities

**Knowledge & Abilities:**

* Utilizing the principles of ABA to influence socially important behavior
* Using a team-based approach to reduce the occurrence of problem behavior
* Serving individuals with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities
* Collaborating with team to create optimal environment for behavior change
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to multi-task

Salary: $90.00 - $105.00 per hour

* Flexible Scheduling

* LBA Certification

title: Delivery Drivers for Evening Routes
description:
**Meal Plan Delivery LLC is filling Delivery Driver Positions in New York City!!** 

These are high energy and rewarding Contracted Positions, with one of the fastest growing courier companies in the area!! Come join our team!!

**Job Overview:**

Delivery Drivers: **(SPACIOUS 4-DOOR VEHICLES or LARGER NEEDED)**

Compensation: **$91 - $128.50 Per Night/Per Shift**

Employment Type: **Part-time**

Pick Up Location: **Long Island City**

**\\*\\*\\*Delivery driver experience is required\\*\\*\\***

**Description of Role:**

We are currently filling positions for part time, contracted, courier/delivery drivers. **All routes are within the 5 boroughs, mostly in Manhattan.** We are looking for good drivers that can follow GPS directions, handle last minute orders and can communicate well with dispatchers and area coordinators.

**Delivery Driver Tasks:**

* Contracted delivery drivers will deliver prepared meals packed in boxes to residences, then scan and take pictures of order placement at each stop.
* Each route consists of up to 25 deliveries and must be completed within a 3-4 hour delivery window.
* Routes cover an average of \\*25 miles.

**Delivery Driver Skills and Requirements**:

* All of our 1099 Independent Contractors drive their own vehicles and are responsible for their own fuel.
* SPACIOUS 4-DOOR VEHICLES are OK, MID-SIZE SUV'S/VANS and LARGER VEHICLES are BEST.
* Must have a current smartphone with EMAIL/GPS and be "App Savvy."
* Must have delivery/driving experience!!
* Must have a good driving record, NO DUI's.
* Clean cut/clean appearance.

**Delivery Driver Schedule:**

* Part Time Sunday nights and Wednesday nights between the operational hours of 7 PM - 11 PM.
* Contracted delivery drivers must be available to provide delivery service on both Sunday and Wednesday nights.

**Delivery Driver Salary and Settlement:**

* Each shift/route pays $91.00 - $128.50 (depending on the route).
* All contracted delivery drivers are paid weekly by direct deposit.

**Overnight routes are also available on Sunday and Wednesday nights, pick up in Long Island City at 11pm, longer routes, more deliveries, more money!!**

*\\*25 miles is the average amount of total driving. Some routes are a little shorter than 25 miles, some routes are a little longer than 25 miles.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $91.00 - $128.50 per day

Shift:

* Evening shift

Work Days:

* Weekends as needed

title: Associate Director of Social Work - BH Social Work Training Academy, MPA BHA *Grant Funded*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

Under direction of the System Director of Social Work, the Associate Director will assist in the oversight of Social Work practice and care delivery of Behavioral Health services. This role demands a dynamic and forward-thinking professional with a strong commitment to Social Work excellence, policy development, and inter-organizational collaboration. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional leadership skills, a strategic mindset, and the ability to drive impactful change across the social work services spectrum. This position requires a blend of clinical expertise, leadership skills, and administrative acumen to ensure the efficient functioning and the provision of high-quality care.

* Support the Systemwide Director of Social Work in the conceptualization, planning, and execution of innovative social work service delivery models and best practices in our behavioral health services.
* Partner in the co-creation of comprehensive policy and practice frameworks pertaining to the Social Work discipline and workforce development in the areas of Behavioral Health such as Outpatient, Inpatient, CPEP/PES, Child Services, Substance Abuse Services and Crisis Care.
* Champion the integration of behavioral health services into non-BH settings by collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to develop and implement strategies that enhance access to and delivery of behavioral health services in diverse healthcare environments.
* Conduct thorough assessments to identify areas for enhancement within social work services and propose strategic initiatives to bolster their effectiveness and efficiency.
* Provide expert advice to the Director on policy adjustments, procedural enhancements, workforce management, and staff development, ensuring alignment with best practices and organizational goals as well as enhancing patient care for our behavioral health patients.
* Forge and maintain collaborative relationships with community organizations, government agencies, and advocacy groups to address clinical care challenges, social determinants of health, and promote health equity.
* Oversee and manage social work-related Electronic Health Record (EPIC) demands, leveraging EMR functionality to enhance practice and streamline operations.
* Provide specialized social work consultation to support program operations and facilitate successful grant development initiatives for the Office of Behavioral Health.
* Act as a liaison with community agencies and professional organizations, fostering productive relationships and addressing mutual concerns with hospital and other functionally related officials as related to behavioral health initiatives and patients.
* Participate actively in appointed meetings and conferences, representing the Director comprehensively in all delegated duties and responsibilities.
* Collaborate closely with facility-based leadership or designated champions to drive behavioral health social work special initiatives that align with organizational objectives.
* Prepare detailed reports, studies, and budgetary estimates to support informed decision-making and strategic planning when necessary.
* Undertake any additional duties as assigned to support the overall mission and objectives of the social work program and the organization.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A Master's Degree (MSW) from an accredited School of Social Work and certification by the State of New York; and,

2. Six years of experience in clinical social work, of which three years are in a health care or medical care setting including psychiatric and medical social work, and three years in a supervisory, consultative and administrative capacity in an organization adhering to acceptable standards with knowledge of administration, with administrative and managerial skills and abilities; or,

3. A satisfactory completion of education, training and experience which includes at least a Master's Degree from an accredited School of Social Work, plus certification from the New York State Department of Education; and,

4. Demonstrated ability to function productively and cooperatively with Director of Social Work, Medical Staff, Administrative Staff and to supervise effectively.

Department Preferences

* Licensure (LMSW or LCSW) issued by The New York State Education Department (NYSED)

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $116,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Full Time - Sales Associate - Flooring - Day
description:
**What You Will Do**  

All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Customer Service Associate, this means:  

* Being friendly and professional, welcoming customers to Lowe’s and helping with home improvement project needs.
* Validating loading tickets and processing orders and deliveries accurately so customers receive merchandise as expected and in a timely manner.
* Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.


The Customer Service Associate is responsible for customers’ experience with Lowe’s. This associate plays a critical role in helping our customers select the right products, ensuring quotes are accurate, verifying correct price labels, and confirming that all customer needs are met. In addition, this associate delivers excellent customer service by listening to customers, using expertise to help customers, and loading merchandise for customers. This associate must always remain vigilant and report any safety or security concerns around the entrance of the store.  

The Customer Service Associate responsibilities vary dependent on the department he/she supports. Customer Service Associates work in one of the following areas: Appliances, Cabinets, Flooring, Live Nursery, Millwork, Fashion Plumbing, Outlet, Tool Rental, Pro, or Windows & Walls. Individuals applying for a role as a Customer Service Associate may be considered for any one of these areas, depending on hiring needs and skillset.  

Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.  

  

**What We're Looking For**  

* Hourly Full Time or Part Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 or up to 25 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
* Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
* Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
* CSAs assigned to the Greeter departments (available in select stores) minimally must be able to lift 10 pounds without assistance; may lift over 10 pounds with or without assistance.
* CSAs assigned to all other departments (excluding Greeter departments) minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.

  

**What You Need To Succeed**  

Minimum Qualifications  

* 6 months of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
* 6 months experience using common retail technology, such as smart phones and tablets.
* Ability to obtain sales related licensure or registration as may be required by law.

  

*Preferred Qualifications*  

* 6 months of sales experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits.
* 6 months of retail experience providing customer service, including identifying and resolving customer issues, assisting customers in locating product, greeting customers, answering phones, building relationships with customers, and thanking customers for their business.
* Bi-lingual skills, if applicable to the store.
* Certification in trade related to department (e.g., hardware, kitchen, plumbing, electrical, lawn and garden, and lumber/building materials).
*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.
company_description: Lowe's is an American chain of retail home improvement and appliance stores that has retail stores in the United States.

title: Clinician
description:
Family Services of Westchester, Inc. (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. Serving 30,000 people a year, including 20,000 children, with nearly 50 innovative programs, including counseling, education and support, FSW is a pillar of health in the Westchester community, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Family Services of Westchester’s Mobile Crisis Response Teams (MCRT) in Port Chester/catchment area and Ossining/Catchment area act as Emergency First Responder Providers for those in the community that are experiencing a mental health, substance use disorder crisis that includes suicide risk. The calls come from Police who have received 911 calls for assistance and there is close collaboration with the corresponding Police departments. The Mobile Crisis Response teams will be prepared 24/7 to respond to crises in person or at times when appropriate by telephone.

**Job Details:**

Family Services of Westchester is currently seeking **Clinicians/Social Workers for our Mobile Crisis Response Teams. MCRT Clinicians** will be first responders and part of a dynamic team that dispatches to mental health crises in the Ossining and Port Chester communities.

**Responsibilities:**

* Dispatch to mental health crises in both Ossining and Port Chester
* Assess, engage, de-escalate and stabilize people and situations
* Help people get linked to the services they need
* Interface with community leaders, police and providers

**Requirements:**

* Fluent in English and Spanish (Preferrred)
* Master’s Degree in Social Work
* LMSW, LMHC, or LMFT (Required)
* Current New York State registration and license as a Licensed Master of Social Work (LMSW) or corresponding degree
* CASAC a plus

* Team-focused collaborator

* Highly organized, self–directed
* Engaged in learning and continuous quality improvement

In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, 403(b) and generous paid time off.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and this position speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please complete the online application on Indeed.com, upload your resume and cover letter with salary requirements. title: Corporate Counsel
description:
Are you ready to revolutionize the cybersecurity landscape? Deep Instinct, the pioneer in applying Deep Learning to cybersecurity, is seeking Corporate Counsel. Imagine being at the forefront of a game-changing technology that protects Fortune 500 companies from the most sophisticated cyber threats. Our innovative platform harnesses the power of deep learning to prevent 99% of known and unknown attacks, including zero-day threats.


We are looking for a passionate attorney who will primarily partner with the sales team to enable the company’s growth. As Corporate Counsel, you will have full responsibility for the life cycle of each contract through the preparation, negotiation, and finalization of contracts as well as advising the company on all legal matters. We are looking for an outstanding attorney with initiative who can handle a high volume of legal work in an exciting and ever changing industry. The successful candidate must be able to understand the effect of the legal and regulatory landscape governing our business and provide strategic counsel to enable revenue generation while creatively balancing commercial and compliance risks.


The successful candidate must possess strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate effectively cross functional partners in finance, operations, and sales to identify, present, and discuss challenges early.

  


Requirements:  

  

* JD and member of NY State Bar;
* At least 3-5 years of experience as a commercial attorney negotiating complex commercial agreements at a major law firm and/or technology company as in-house counsel;
* Excellent oral and written communication skills;
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team player;
* Ability to handle multiple projects at one time with continually changing priorities;
* Must be highly organized to be able to handle high volume of work in fast paced environment, detail oriented, collaborative and team-oriented attitude.


Experience with Salesforce a plus

  

Office Location:
  

NYC  

  

Region:
  

North America  

  

Responsibilities::  

  

* Draft, review, negotiate, and finalize agreements, termination letters and other legal documents, as required;
* Monitor status of contract review and execution, including supporting the contract approval and signature process;
* Provide recommendations and alternative resolutions throughout negotiations using established escalation channels;
* Provide legal advice on a variety of topics, including employment law, mergers and acquisitions, and regulatory compliance;
* Manage outside counsel and establish procedures for evaluating the quality, performance and cost of services of outside counsel.
* Oversee the further development and maintenance of the company’s privacy program; and
* Maintain updated knowledge of legal and regulatory developments that are relevant to the company.

  

Why Work With Us::  

  

**Why Deep Instinct?**

* Work with cutting-edge AI technology in cybersecurity.
* Dynamic, fast-paced startup environment where your ideas make a real difference.
* Collaborate with top minds in cybersecurity and AI.
* Protect some of the world's largest organizations from cyber threats.
* Clear path for career growth and development.

 **Our Culture**


At Deep Instinct, we foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We believe in empowering our team members to think creatively and take ownership of their projects. Our work is challenging, but we have fun doing it! Salary range is 190-230k
company_description: We are the only cyber security company harnessing the the power of deep learning to prevent 99% of known and unknown attacks from malware and zero-day threats.

We’re a results-driven team that values problem-solving, taking initiative, personal integrity, and professionalism. As an Executive Assistant & Team Administrator, you will manage all logistical aspects of the Managing Partners' time by screening, prioritizing, routing, and escalating a high volume of requests from a fast-paced global organization.


This is a great opportunity for someone with high-energy, excellent communication skills, attention to detail, comfortability with complexity and uncertainty, the ability to manage internal and external relationships and work with senior executives and cross-functional teams.

  

In this role, you will:

description:
**Role and Responsibilities:** *Under direction, the Program Nutritionist will work in the WIC Program to develop and implement dietary plans based on nutritional assessment and the special nutritional needs of individuals; performs related duties as required: Confers with physicians and other members of the health team to correlate the individual's nutritional care plan with other care plans.*

* Collects, organizes, and interprets nutrition assessment and socioeconomic data on clients.
* Discusses problems affecting individual's food habits and needs for special diet requirements.
* Participate in field experiences for students in public health nutrition and other public health disciplines.
* Provides counseling to individuals and families on their diet and food shopping techniques to improve their nutritional status.
* Gives individual or group instruction to persons on restricted or nutritionally imbalanced diets, taking into consideration their psychological, social, and economic needs.
* Participates in community health fairs and supports enrollment in the nutritional program.
* Provides community referrals based on needs.
* Measure height, weight and bloodwork as needed.

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a major concentration in Dietetics, Nutrition, Food, Food Science, or Food Service Management (required). Completion of a dietetic internship and professional experience in nutrition when combined totals one (1) year, or one (1) year of full-time professional experience in nutrition, preferred. Masters/RD encouraged to apply.

**Preferred Skills**

* Bilingual English/Spanish, English/French, and/or English/Haitian Creole highly encouraged to apply.
* Knowledge of principles in normal/therapeutic nutrition and drug nutrient interaction at all stages of life.
* Ability to understand the individuals basic/psychological/social needs, developmental processes and culturally acquired attitudes/habits.

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group home in Hackettstown, NJ.

**Salary is based on education, experience. This home offers a $2.25 per hour pay differential.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

title: Environmental Service Aide
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Coler is an 815-bed nursing facility with a 5-Star CMS Quality Rating located on Roosevelt Island, nestled between Manhattan and Queens. Coler offers long term and subacute care, rehabilitation, and a dedicated memory care unit, comprised of 150 beds featuring an acclaimed music and memory program. The facility features a robust rehabilitation therapy program with expansive gym space for residents. Coler also offers full time physician staff, psychiatry, dental services, an onsite 8-chair dialysis den for hemodialysis, and on-site medical clinics to meet the clinical needs of its residents.

From more than 600 Nursing Homes, Coler ranks #5 in Newsweek’s Best Nursing Homes in New York 2024; and also received a 2024 Silver Beacon Award for Memory Care.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

Purpose of Position: Under direct supervision, performs work of ordinary difficulty and responsibility in the areas of food services, housekeeping and maintenance and grounds operations; performs related work

In the area of Housekeeping Operations:

1. Cleans, maintains and/or sterilizes assigned areas of the facility by emptying wastebaskets, sweeping, dusting, vacuuming and washing/mopping floors, walls, ceilings, window sills, Venetian blinds, furniture and medical equipment with appropriate cleaning equipment, solutions and disinfectants. Bags soiled linen.

2. Cleans mirrors and scours and disinfects toilets, sinks, tubs and showers using appropriate cleaning equipment, solutions and disinfectants.

3. Cleans unsterile trays and equipment. Cleans and sterilizes metal containers, sputum disposal room and equipment. Distributes clean sputum cups, containers and paper bags for waste to patients. Collects and disposes of cups and waste, handles and disposes of sputum specimen containers. Fills ice compartment of oxygen equipment and obtains oxygen tanks when required.

4. Polishes metal. Maintains floors by stripping, waxing and polishing utilizing appropriate cleaning equipment.

5. Collects, empties, transports and/or disposes of debris and garbage in designated containers. Relines waste containers with appropriate liner(s) and transports infectious waste material to designated areas.

6. Assists in loading and unloading trucks and filling stock requisitions. Transports household supplies and equipment and assists supervisor in such tasks as distributing cleaning supplies.

7. Moves furniture and equipment, and assists in the make up and breakdown of beds (including their proper storage).

8. Maintains control over tools and equipment. Keeps mechanical equipment in proper running order. 9. May perform auxiliary services in hospital laboratories, pharmacies and other special areas

Additional duties as required by the department

Minimum Qualifications

Ability to read and write English and to understand and carry out simple instructions.

Ability to work nights, weekends and holidays

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or go to employment.nychhc.org

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week

Retirement Savings and Pension Plans

Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees

Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts

College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities

Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.43 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 15 per week

Experience:

* Cleaning: 1 year (Required)

Shift availability:

* Night Shift (Preferred)
* Overnight Shift (Preferred)
* Day Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10044 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10044: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Paralegal
company: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP & Affiliates
description:
We invite you to review our current professional staff openings to learn about the opportunities available across the firm.  

About Us
Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP (Skadden) has forged a reputation as one of the most prestigious law firms in the world. By relying on innovation, intellect, teamwork and tenacity, our lawyers deliver the highest quality advice and novel solutions to our clients' legal issues. We are recognized as a global powerhouse for complex transactions, litigation/controversy issues, and regulatory matters, as well as for the open, collaborative relationships we build with clients. Our attorneys, who reflect diverse backgrounds and perspectives, collaborate seamlessly across 50-plus practices and 21 offices in the world’s major financial centers.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a Paralegal to join our Firm. Within this position, you will be responsible for providing attorneys, members of the department, and other professional staff with diversified clerical, administrative, and case/deal support by handling complex tasks and projects, with limited supervision, throughout all phases and aspects of Corporate work. This position will be based in our New York office and has a hybrid in-office/remote working schedule. Please note that the Firm will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.
As the Paralegal you will:* Provide assistance to case/deal teams in relation to Corporate Practice-related skills.
* Serve as a Corporate Practice resource for attorneys, colleagues, and other support staff.
* Assist with retrieval of rules, regulations, and company profiles.
* Proofread corporate-related deal documents.
* Perform cross-reference and defined terms checks.
* Assist with DocuSign requests.
* Conduct research for attorneys and members of the department.
* Update attorney and case/deal team binders.
* Assist with preparing audit letter responses.
* Assist with managing virtual data rooms (VDRs).
* Handle complex projects with limited supervision.
* Organize and manage electronic and paper files.
* Ensure that all files are maintained within department-approved protocols and case management systems.
* Maintain the integrity of client files.
* Perform non-legal research using various research tools, including the Internet, SEC/EDGAR, and other media and financial services sites.
* Update attorney and case/deal team binders.
* Manage databases in accordance with Firm standards.
* Assist other paralegals and attorneys across practice areas.
* Demonstrate strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills to facilitate effective work relationships.
* Manage Firm resources responsibly.
* Comply with and understand Firm operation, policies and procedures.

* Ability to navigate various electronic databases and document repositories
* Strong research skills and proficiency in using various research tools, including the Internet, Westlaw, LexisNexis, PACER, SEC/EDGAR, and other court-related websites and/or media and financial services
* Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, organizational, and planning skills

* Ability to work well independently, as well as effectively, within a team

* Ability to organize and prioritize work
* Ability to handle multiple projects and shifting priorities
* Ability to work well in a demanding and fast-paced environment
* Ability to work well under pressure
* Demonstrates close attention to detail
* Flexibility to travel, as required
* Flexibility to adjust hours and work the hours necessary to meet operating and business needs


Education/Experience:* Bachelor’s degree

We believe in teamwork and inspiring each other to be our best in an atmosphere that promotes professionalism and excellence in all that we do. title: Home Health Aide (HHA)/PCA - MALE - ENGLISH SPEAKING - 10PM-10AM
description:
ProLife Home Care is hiring Home Health Aide.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide home care services to elderly individuals or individuals with developmental disabilities, memory care needs, blind or other medical conditions.  
- Assist with activities of daily living, such as bathing, dressing, and grooming.  
- Administer medication and assist with medical documentation as required.  
- Perform specialized medical tasks as needed.  
- Prepare meals and assist with meal planning and nutrition.  
- Maintain a clean and safe living environment for clients.  
- Provide companionship and emotional support to clients.  
- Follow all HIPAA regulations and maintain client confidentiality.

Skills:  
- Previous experience working with individuals with Alzheimer's or memory care needs is preferred.  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with clients, families, and healthcare professionals.  
- Compassionate and patient demeanor when working with clients who may have physical or cognitive limitations.  
- Ability to follow instructions and work independently while adhering to care plans.  
- Knowledge of basic medical procedures and ability to provide basic first aid if necessary.

Please note that this position may require occasional travel to healthcare facilities for client appointments or consultations.

If you are passionate about providing quality home care services and making a positive impact on the lives of others, we encourage you to apply.

Summary  
As a Home Health Aide (HHA), you will be an essential part of providing compassionate care and support to individuals in their homes. With core skills in home & community care, patient care, and senior care, you will assist with activities of daily living, medication administration, and care plans. Your premium skills in patient observation, Alzheimer's care, and first aid will enable you to provide specialized care for individuals with memory care needs. Additionally, your relevant skills in cleaning, meal preparation, and medical documentation will ensure a safe and comfortable environment for those under your care. Join our team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients.

Qualifications  
- Home health aide (HHA) or Personal Care Aide (PCA) certification  
- Experience in patient care, particularly in home and community settings  
- Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and patient confidentiality  
- Ability to provide care for seniors and individuals with Alzheimer's  
- Proficiency in patient observation and assisting with activities of daily living (ADLs)  
- Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a caregiving team

title: Clinical Business Analyst Level II - SUD Acute Care Services, MPA BHA *Grant Funded*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals:**

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

**NYC Health + Hospitals** is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description:**

* Oversee data reporting for all H+H SUD acute care-funded initiatives within H+H SUD programs as well as those managed through the Office of Behavioral Health (OBH).
* Oversee development and optimization of SUD acute care services dashboarding, Epic electronic medical record (EMR) clinical documentation tools, and reports to inform QI and satisfy grant funding deliverables.
* Provide data validation, especially for totals, rates, and additional statistical statements published in reports and dashboards.
* Provide descriptive and analytical reports, including tables, graphs, and figures; adhere to deadlines for regular periodic reporting and fulfill ad hoc requests for targeted data and analyses.
* Partner with dashboard/report sponsors to gather requirements, document business processes and workflows, and explore potential solutions with the service delivery teams.
* Interview end users and stakeholders to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional, and technical requirement documents based on captured data and, in accordance with departmental protocols and standards.
* Create data solutions that support the stakeholder’s need for report generation, automation, scripting, coding and/or troubleshooting.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and provide analysis and propose change and communicate strategies.
* Communicate requirements to technical personnel through the construction of basic conceptual data, process models and flowcharts, and technical specifications.
* Verify that solutions meet business, compliance, and technical requirements prior to publication.
* Provide SUD acute care service project management assistance with the development, implementation, and optimization of programmatic workflows.
* Plan, organize, facilitate, and lead meetings and workgroups around SUD data and assigned workflows; oversee and execute follow-up activities.
* Liaise with academic or other partners to support programmatic evaluation/research.
* Participate in behavioral health/SUD departmental and interdepartmental meetings.
* Contribution to peer-reviewed publications and conference presentations on SUD service interventions, highlighting outcomes and informing best practices for future programming.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor and departmental leadership

**Minimum Qualifications:**

1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or

2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or

3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.

4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

**Department Preferences**

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and other Requirements:**

* Minimum 2 years of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements for software applications development and implementation in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area
* Experience with or exposure to data analysis in SQL, SAS, R, Python, Microsoft Excel, and Tableau
* Experience analyzing EMR-derived data is a priority
* Experience working effectively in a public hospital setting or a closely related field including long-term, acute, ambulatory care, medical service administration, public administration, or within substance use programming

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $71,008.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Field Service Technician, Electrical, DSF/PCR - WEST COAST
description:
**APPLY NOW**

**Bobst North America (BNA)** named to Forbes Best Midsize Employers List 3 years in a row! Do you want to be a part of a Global organization within the packaging industry? Did you know that around half of the packaging used today has been touched by a BOBST machine?


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, **BOBST** has always been at the forefront of innovation, and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.


**BOBST** is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.


At **BOBST** we put customer service at the heart of everything we do, and we are looking for a new team member to join us to provide world class service for world class machines!  

* **90% TRAVEL REQUIRED – Candidates must have flexibility to travel extensively throughout US and Canada. Ideal candidate located within 1 hour from a major international airport.**


We are seeking an experienced **Field Service Technician (FST), Electrical, for the DSF/PCR product line**. The FST provides timely and efficient machine repairs and installations primarily for customers in the Folding Carton product range. This individual will serve as the front-line representative for the **BOBST** product range.  

  

The FST is at the core of an extensive support network of service personnel worldwide. This trusted advisor is the key customer representative, responsible for confirming, clarifying, and meeting the customers’ expectations at every stage of contact and on every service, project relating to our machines. The FST possesses a strong background in the principles of electrical & mechanical engineering. They think logically and enjoy solving problems with creativity, diligence and above all else, focus on excellent customer service.
**Principle Responsibilities:**  

Machine Service (electrical & mechanical), including the repair and installation of new machines, relocation of existing equipment, customer training, preventative maintenance, ordering parts necessary to perform installations and repair, troubleshooting problems and proactively recommend the necessary service and maintenance programs.


**Key Skills & Attributes:**  

*This role is perfect for you if you have had prior experience in –*  

* Minimum **5 years’ experience** in the packaging industry or finishing converting industry working as an electrician on flat bed die cutters
* Background in electrical engineering
* Diagnosing faults and make recommendations in customer environment.
* Knowledgeable with VFDs, Servo drives, PLC logics
* Basic computer programming
* Electrical & electronic circuits wiring and troubleshooting
* Knowledge of hand and power tools

*To be considered for this role, candidates should have –*  

* Strong analysis skills and attention to detail
* Independent, responsible work style
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment
* Fluency with metric system


**Education:**  

* Technical school or college related to Technology Science, Industrial Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.  

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.  



**APPLY NOW**

title: Machine Operator
description:
We are seeking a motivated Machine Operator to join our business. This is a steel production equipment operator position responsible for properly reading and executing work orders to timely meet customer requirements. This non-exempt (hourly) position typically reports directly to the Warehouse Supervisor or Manager and has no supervisory responsibilities. The position requires working in accordance with Triple-S Steel job requirements and Safe Methods of Work. Overtime hours may be required to meet our customers’ needs.

Responsibilities:

* Follow Triple-S safe methods of work at all times, and immediately advise supervisor of any unsafe conditions.
* Manipulate, cut and/or form raw material according to work orders to meet customer requirements.
* Maintain and safely operate tools and equipment as assigned, including but not limited to tape measure, caliper, shear, CNC burning table, band saw, iron worker, track burner, haven tube cutter, forklift, overhead crane and personal protective equipment.
* Lift and carry up to 50 pounds for up to 20 feet to heights of 5 feet; exert 25 to 50 pounds of force frequently and/or 10 to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects, reach, squat, stand, walk up to 2 miles per day, climb up stairs, ladders and on equipment while wearing required personal protective equipment as necessary.
* Maintain spatial orientation and awareness to safely move around work environment with many moving objects.
* Use clear vision to judge near and far distance to maintain awareness of ongoing work activities of other employees.
* Work indoors and outdoors in all kinds of weather conditions including precipitation, cold/heat, high wind, and turbulent conditions. The Machine Operator will be regularly exposed to the typical weather of the local area.
* Attending all required company meetings.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

* Steel knowledge; 1 year (Preferred)
* CNC Machine Operator; 1 year
* HS Diploma or equivalent
* Ability to correctly read and understand work order and/or receive oral instructions to determine work assignments or with material and equipment needs.
* Ability to effectively use basic computer applications.
* Demonstrate intermediate math skills (add, subtract, multiple, divide).
* Ability to safely meet or exceed minimum productivity levels established by the company.
* Ability to effectively plan and organize work activities independent of direct supervision, work alone and in a team environment.
* Develop a good working knowledge of material and inventory control techniques and procedures.
* Ability to maintain ongoing inter-department communications related to routing, safety and customer relations.

Other:

* Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands/fingers to handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.
* Working Conditions: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals and risk of electrical shock when in the operations or laboratory areas. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate, but due to open office environment noise level may occasionally be high.

Disclaimer: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$500 FOR PART TIME, $1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group homes in Bergen County (Hackensack, Bogota, Englewood).

**Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & Sick Time

· Employee Referral Bonus Program

· 403b Retirement Plan

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

description:

Are you passionate about wine and enjoy working in a hands-on, dynamic environment? The Wine Cellar Group is looking for a friendly, upbeat Retail Wine Sales and E Commerce Associate to help provide exceptional customer service while managing inventory and supporting daily operations. title: Server
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking dedicated Servers to join our team. As a Server, you will be responsible for providing excellent customer service and ensuring guest satisfaction by taking orders, serving food and beverages, and maintaining a clean dining environment.

title: Finished Goods Planner
description:
Step into our world of creativity and joy!  



Finished Goods Planner


Join us and celebrate the beauty of human experience. Create for happier, healthier lives, with love for nature. Together, with kindness, humility, and a spirit of adventure, we deliver food innovations, craft inspired fragrances and develop beauty and wellbeing solutions. There’s much to learn from our 79 production sites worldwide, known for their best-in-class processes and procedures. There’s many to learn from, with high-performing leaders and caring colleagues to explore ideas and ambitions with. Every day, your energy, your personality, and your determination will shape our future, making a positive difference on billions of people. Every essence of you enriches our world. We are Givaudan. Human by nature.

Join us and celebrate the beauty of human experience. Create for happier, healthier lives, with love for nature. Together, with our customers, we deliver food innovations, craft inspired fragrances and develop beauty and wellbeing solutions. There's much to learn and many to learn from, with more than 16,800 employees around the world to explore ideas and ambitions with. Every day, your talent, your personality, and your passion will shape our future, making a positive difference on billions of people. Every essence of you enriches our world. We are Givaudan. Human by nature.  


As a Finished Goods Planner you will report to the Production Planning Team Lead. As such you will execute production planning activities for intermediates and finished goods. Assure that production plans are created such that products can be manufactured as efficiently as possible, without interruption and supplied on time to our customers. Create a production plan in alignment with schedule and production requirements. Ensure agreed stock levels for customers are met. Minimize write-offs and optimize inventory levels.  


**Your role will include:**  


* Creation of production plan that is executable and in line with productivity and service targets


* Inventory levels meet or exceed company targets


* Supply Chain and Commercial Write-off levels meet budget


* Optimize service to internal and external customers


* Review and analyze production requirements in MRP (Material Requirements Planning) and production capacity to ensure on time customer response times and product availability


* Track and review customer orders for production and resale demands, including raw material resale


* Develop an understanding of the replenishment and production systems and processes including MRP, demand and capacity


* Develop understanding of technological, food safety and dietary requirements around produced items and production sites, such as allocation matrix, Halal, Kosher.


* Build effective relationships with important partners and teams such as Customer Care, Production, Scheduling, Raw Material planning, Quality, Transport, and GBS Supply Planning.


* Resolve or escalate supply issues working with team members as required. Manage exceptions.


* Share best practice and ideas with your team; involve teams as needed to achieve the most efficient ways of working


* Support cost reduction projects and improvement initiatives


* Review slow moving and obsolete inventory


* Follow Givaudan procedures, guidelines and best-practice on relevant areas including Safety; address and implement where missing


* Support development of training programs, manuals and methods of implementation to assure stable and best practice execution of planning


* Review and audit material lead times


* Work under the standards of quality, safety and industrial hygiene.

  


**You?**  


Want to join a team that's passionate about innovation and creativity, and that works together to achieve extraordinary things? It's your essence that we're looking for.  


**Your professional profile includes:**  


* Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Operations Management, Business Administration or equivalent


* 2-3 years experience in supply planning, supply chain, production planning Knowledge of Production Planning, Inventory Management, Capacity Analysis, Demand, Supply and Supply Chain best practice


* APICS is a plus


* Experience in the flavour, ingredient or fragrance industry is a plus


* 6 sigma / lean Yellow or Green Belt preferred


* Strong working knowledge in planning. Preferably has experience with demand, supply and or production.


* Strong Negotiation & Problem Solving Skills. Shows agility and flexibility when solving complex problems.


* Strong affinity to systems and analytical tools.


* Continuous improvement mindset


* Working knowledge BI, BO, MS Office, Google and SAP


* Ability to achieve results through formal and informal channels


* Language Skills: English and other language(s) as required

  


Benefits include medical, dental, vision, and a high matching 401k  


At Givaudan, you work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive from other passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions. **Every essence of you enriches our world.**
Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners. Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.
#LI-Onsite  

At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives.  

You work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions.  

Every essence of you enriches our world.  

Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners.  

Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.
**Remote working:** Hybrid
company_description: Givaudan is a global leader in Fragrance & Beauty and Taste & Wellbeing. We celebrate the beauty of human experience by creating for happier, healthier lives with love for nature.

description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$500 FOR PART TIME, $1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Morris, Bergen, and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Part Time and Per Diem Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group homes across Morris County, Bergen County and Somerset County.

Port Murray has a $2.25/hr pay differential.

**Available Shifts:** Saturday 7am-3pm

Friday, Saturday 11pm-7am & Friday 3pm-11pm

**Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

* Paid Training
* Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays
* Generous Paid Time Off (PTO)

title: Food Service Aide
description:
**About** 

NYC Health + Hospitals/Coler is an 815-bed nursing facility with a 5-Star CMS Quality Rating located on Roosevelt Island, nestled between Manhattan and Queens. Coler offers long term and subacute care, rehabilitation, and a dedicated memory care unit, comprised of 150 beds featuring an acclaimed music and memory program. The facility features a robust rehabilitation therapy program with expansive gym space for residents. Coler also offers full time physician staff, psychiatry, dental services, an onsite 8-chair dialysis den for hemodialysis, and on-site medical clinics to meet the clinical needs of its residents.

From more than 600 Nursing Homes, Coler ranks #5 in Newsweek’s Best Nursing Homes in New York 2024; and also received a 2024 Silver Beacon Award for Memory Care.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

Under direct supervision, performs work of ordinary difficulty and responsibility in the preparation and cooking of food in a health care facility; performs related work.

Examples of Typical Tasks : 1. Checks menu cards, special and/or modified diet lists to determine types and quantities of foods to be prepared in accordance with standard procedures. 2. Prepares or supervises the washing, trimming, cooking and seasoning of all food items. 3. Utilizes a variety of kitchen utensils and equipment such as blenders, mixers, grinders, slicers and tenderizers in the preparation and cooking of foods. 4. Prepares food utilizing such equipment as steam kettles, grills and ovens. Maintains correct temperatures for all foods. 5. Tastes foods for consistency and seasoning and corrects as necessary to assure proper flavor and texture. 6. Apportions servings and prepares or directs the preparation and distribution of food to serving areas in accordance with departmental standards. 7. Inspects foods and meats in work and storage areas for compliance with storage, safety and sanitary standards. 8. Instructs and supervises all dietary aides assigned to unit and assists in orientation and in-service training programs. 9. Participates in daily menu conferences and confers with Supervisor concerning menus, food preparation, quality recipes, use of leftovers and related matters.

**Minimum Qualifications**

1. Elementary school graduation through the eighth grade, plus a formal course in basic cooking principles, and a New York City Department of Health Food Protection Course Certificate; and,

2. Two years of full-time, paid experience as a Cook; or,

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, experience and training; and,

4. Ability to read and write English and to understand and carry out instructions.

**How To Apply**

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week

Retirement Savings and Pension Plans

Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees

Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts

College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities

Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Administrative Assistant/Billing Assistant
description:
Founded in 2003, Lydecker is a growing AV-rated full-service law firm with over 140 attorneys in thirteen offices throughout Florida, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, California, and Georgia. We currently have an opening for an detail-oriented Admin/Billing Assistant to join our team.

The ideal candidate will have at least one year of experience in an administrative role within an organization, preferably a law firm. They should be highly proficient with computers, including familiarity with legal billing software and Microsoft Office Suite.

Key Responsibilities:

* Assist in the execution of the firm’s billing process, including editing and maintaining prebills, updating budgetary information, and invoice submission.
* Perform general bookkeeping tasks, maintain records, and support documents related to billing.
* Communicate with clients regarding billing inquiries and issues through various channels.
* Assist with month-end and year-end close processes for the billing department.
* Monitor and approve new matter report information into the legal billing software.
* Research and respond to internal and external requests related to billing.
* Produce standardized and ad-hoc reports as requested by management.
* Update billing rates and client information in the billing system as needed.
* Coordinate with the Records Manager to close client files and maintain confidentiality.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

* Minimum of 1 year of experience in an administrative role.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, with skills in Excel.
* Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* High school diploma or equivalent; Associate’s degree preferred.

***Come join our office in New York!***

**Vision:** Our vision at Lydecker is to be a trusted partner that redefines excellence in legal services. We envision a future where our innovative approach to client service sets new standards in the legal industry. With a relentless commitment to integrity, collaboration, and excellence, we aspire to be the first choice for clients seeking unparalleled solutions and results. Together, we will shape the future of legal practice, empowering individuals, and clients to thrive in an ever-evolving world.

**Mission Statement:** At Lydecker, our mission is simple: to exceed client expectations with efficient, strategic, and collaborative service. We're dedicated to long-term success for our clients, attorneys, and staff, fostering a culture of excellence and teamwork.

**Company Values:**

1. **Excellence**: At Lydecker, we are committed to excellence in all that we do. We strive for the highest standards of quality, professionalism, and innovation in delivering legal services. Our dedication to excellence drives us to continually improve, adapt, and exceed expectations.

2. **Integrity:** Integrity is the cornerstone of our relationships, both internally and with our clients. We conduct ourselves with honesty, transparency, and ethical behavior always. Trust is paramount, and we uphold the highest standards of integrity in every interaction, decision, and action we take.

3. **Collaboration:** We believe in the power of collaboration to achieve greater success. At Lydecker, we foster a culture of teamwork, respect, and support among our attorneys and staff. By working together seamlessly, leveraging diverse perspectives, and sharing knowledge, we maximize our collective talents to deliver exceptional results for our clients.

4. **Care:** We take care of our people because we genuinely care about each one of them, and we believe that by fostering a culture of care, we can create a more resilient, supportive, and successful organization for all. We show that we care about our employees through employee well-being, professional growth and development, work-life balance, diversity and inclusion, and community engagement

Interested candidates may reply to this posting or contact careers@lydecker.com for immediate and confidential consideration.

*To learn more about Lydecker LLP, please visit our website at www.Lydecker.com or visit LinkedIn #LydeckerCareers #LydeckerLife.*
