title: Patient Service Representative
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Patient Service Representative (PSR) is responsible for welcoming and providing exemplary customer service to all our incoming patients at CityMD. The person in this position is responsible for registering patients and coordinating with the rest of the team to provide a timely turnaround for the patient. This individual responds to patient questions and concerns with a sense of urgency and kindness, both on the telephone and in person and is responsible for all paperwork associated with patient registration.

**Essential** **Functions/Responsibilities**
--------------------------------------------

* Greeting and welcoming patients
* Organizing and coordinating patient in-take and other appointments
* Accurately enters/updates patient information in system
* Assisting patients with completion of paperwork when necessary
* Scanning, updating and filing medical records
* Answering phone calls, questions, etc. in a prompt and polite manner
* Processing medical insurance information, verifying patient eligibility and addressing any patient questions about insurance (liaise with Billing department as appropriate)
* Handling cash and co-payments accurately and responsibly
* Providing outstanding customer service to every patient
* Informing site manager or assistant site manager of waiting room wait times, patient inquiries, etc.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* A High School Degree or GED
* Happy, welcoming, and can-do attitude with patients and coworkers
* Experience working in any high-volume/high-intensity service industry (e.g., hospitality, restaurant, hospital, medical office or retail environment) preferred
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Detail-oriented and a team player
* Computer Proficiency and superior keyboarding skills (approximately 55 wpm)
* Flexible/adaptable nature to work in a continuously evolving environment
* Passion for helping others in a healthcare environment
* Ability to effectively interact with physicians, patients and other staff members
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

**Physical requirements**
-------------------------


Ability to sit and stand for periods of time. Heavy computer use required.


Pay Range $18.25/hr


The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.

**About Our Commitment**
========================

**Total Rewards at VillageMD**
------------------------------


Our team members are essential to our mission to reshape healthcare through the power of connection. VillageMD highly values the critical role that health and wellness play in the lives of our team members and their families. Participation in VillageMD’s benefit platform includes Medical, Dental, Life, Disability, Vision, FSA coverages and a 401k savings plan.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
------------------------------


Our Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of, race, color, religion, creed, gender/sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression (including transgender status), national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, military status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws.

**Safety Disclaimer**
---------------------


Our Company cares about the safety of our employees and applicants. Our Company does not use chat rooms for job searches or communications. Our Company will never request personal information via informal chat platforms or unsecure email. Our Company will never ask for money or an exchange of money, banking or other personal information prior to the in-person interview. Be aware of potential scams while job seeking. Interviews are conducted at select Our Company locations during regular business hours only. For information on job scams, visit, https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/JobScams or file a complaint at https://www.ftccomplaintassistant.gov/.

title: Medical Scribe - Pelham Parkway
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Scribe Tech is responsible for:  

* Capturing accurate and detailed documentation of the patient visit into the EMR in a timely manner.
* Assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures.
* Assisting site managers with directing patient flow, inventory, and following up on labs.
* Ensuring site lab compliance with Department of Health (DOH) Regulations.
* Provide unparalleled customer service to our patients, adhering to established protocols and work processes, and successfully managing volume without ever compromising quality.

  

**Essential** **Functions/Responsibilities:**  

  

* Being able to manage a minimum of two patients per hour on average and be able to manage a minimum of three to four patients per hour during surge periods.
* Assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures, which may include but is not limited to phlebotomy, Urine Drug Screens, rapid point of care testing, UA, EKG, procedure set ups, etc.
* Ensuring Department of Health (DOH) compliance of site lab and exam rooms which may include but is not limited to logbook maintenance, checking for expired medications and supplies, proper handling of specimens etc.
* Escort patients to exam rooms, x-rays or other facilities on site as needed.
* Ability to maintain quick pace in fast paced urgent care facility for the duration of scheduled shift (8-12 hours except for meals/break time).
* Facilitating any necessary diagnostic tests (e.g., CT, MRI, ultrasounds, etc.) and referrals to medical specialists for follow-up care via Aftercare
* Assisting the physician with basic patient care and medical procedures set-ups
* Communicating with patients, pharmacies, and physicians over the phone under physician guidance.
* Helping maintain a clean, courteous, and professional working environment.
* Ensuring the site is fully stocked with supplies.
* Providing compassionate care to our patients.

  

**Qualifications:**  

  

A candidate’s qualifications will include:  

* High School Degree or GED, Undergraduate degree a plus
* Graduation from an accredited Medical Assisting program and/or phlebotomy certifications a plus, but not required. Training will be provided.
* Friendly and professional with excellent bedside manner.
* Flexible with full-time work schedule including a weekend day.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
* High attention to detail.
* Must exhibit passion for outstanding results and compassion for those we work with and serve.
* Team player.
* Knowledge of third-party payor requirements preferred.
* Strong aptitude for detail, and ability to work independently, required.
* Strong organizational, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills required.
* Computer Proficiency
* Happy and positive thinking, able to project this attitude around others.
* Flexible & adaptable nature to work in a continuously evolving environment.
* Passion for helping others in an urgent care environment.
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on-site location.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required at time of hire.

  

**Physical requirements:**  

  

The job may require at times to lift light to moderate amounts of weight (e.g., boxes of medical/facility supplies) to assist team members. Job also requires the ability to maintain a quick pace in fast paced urgent care medical facility for the duration of scheduled shift minus meal/break time.  

  

**Pay Rate $19.75/hr**  

The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.
#INDScribe

**About Our Commitment**
========================

**Total Rewards at VillageMD**

title: Patient Service Representative - Richmond
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Patient Care Representative (PCR) is responsible for welcoming and providing exemplary customer service to all our incoming patients at CityMD. The person in this position is responsible for registering patients and coordinating with the rest of the team to provide a timely turnaround for the patient. This individual responds to patient questions and concerns with a sense of urgency and kindness, both on the telephone and in person and is responsible for all paperwork associated with patient registration.

**Essential** **Functions/Responsibilities**
--------------------------------------------

* Greeting and welcoming patients
* Organizing and coordinating patient in-take and other appointments
* Accurately enters/updates patient information in system
* Assisting patients with completion of paperwork when necessary
* Scanning, updating and filing medical records
* Answering phone calls, questions, etc. in a prompt and polite manner
* Processing medical insurance information, verifying patient eligibility and addressing any patient questions about insurance (liaise with Billing department as appropriate)
* Handling cash and co-payments accurately and responsibly
* Providing outstanding customer service to every patient
* Informing site manager or assistant site manager of waiting room wait times, patient inquiries, etc.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* A High School Degree or GED
* Happy, welcoming, and can-do attitude with patients and coworkers
* Experience working in any high-volume/high-intensity service industry (e.g., hospitality, restaurant, hospital, medical office or retail environment) preferred
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Detail-oriented and a team player
* Computer Proficiency and superior keyboarding skills (approximately 55 wpm)
* Flexible/adaptable nature to work in a continuously evolving environment
* Passion for helping others in a healthcare environment
* Ability to effectively interact with physicians, patients and other staff members
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on site location.

**Physical requirements**
-------------------------


Ability to sit and stand for periods of time. Heavy computer use required.


Pay Range $18.25/hr


The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.

title: Office Supervisor - Sunset Park
description:
**About Our Company**
=====================


We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.


Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.


When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.

**Job Description**
===================


The Office Supervisor is responsible for assisting in managing, overseeing, and ensuring the successful administrative, financial, and operational aspects of an urgent care location. A supervisor is accountable for:  

  

* Managing team members in partnership with Practice Manager
* Supporting a patient-centric urgent care experience from welcome to departure of the facility and ensuring an inviting and hospitable environment
* Supporting overall functions of the site, team, and providers with day-to-day operations.

  

**Essential** **Functions/Responsibilities:**  

  

Site Management  

  

* Managing the performance of the site; understanding at all times of how many patients have visited the site, whether there are any delays in the registration process, and what follow-up needs to be conducted after a patient is discharged.
* Assisting the Practice Manager preparing the schedule for non-providers
* Ordering all medical supplies, medications, vaccinations, and office supplies for the site
* Opening and closing the site as required
* Assisting the Practice Manger in administrative and operational responsibilities

  

**People Management**  

  

* Building strong positive communication with providers and working as a team to enhance the success of the practice.
* Ensuring staff always maintains professionalism, coaching, managing, and developing the staff.
* Managing the team from interviewing, performance, promotion, discipline, etc.
* Collaborating with the HR team to formalize a development plan for staff as well as managing employee relations issues such as formal write-ups and suggestions for improvement.

  

**Business and Patient Management**  

  

* Maintaining patient confidentiality in accordance with policy and procedure as well as HIPAA requirements.
* Interacting with patients (and families) at discharge in a courteous and respectful manner, resolving disputes, and reviewing patient satisfaction cards.

  

**Qualifications**  

  

* High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s degree in management, business or other applicable degree preferred (will consider relevant management experience in lieu of degree).
* Minimum 1 year of supervising or managing experience a must OR a degree in management.
* Ability to successfully multitask.
* Good computer skills (knowledge of a PC, Microsoft Office programs)
* Exceptional communication skills
* Comfortable with delivering constructive feedback and counseling management.
* Bilingual language skills required or preferred based on-site location.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required at time of hire.

  

**Additional Information:**  

This job will require long shifts, weekends, closing, opening shifts (will depend on schedule necessary at facility) and must work on-site.  

  

**Physical requirements**  

The job may require from time to time lifting heavy objects on a regular basis, doing repetitive tasks with few breaks, and requiring light cleaning. Heavy computer use required.  

  

**Direct reports**  

The Supervisor will be responsible for directly managing the site employees.  

  

**Pay Range: $22-25/hr**  

The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.

title: Security Officer (Weekend Post/ Overnight)
description:
QPS Security Officer is responsible to ensure the safety of staff and visitors in primarily class “A” office buildings, positions are also available in retail and residential buildings. Monitor access control systems including turnstiles, cameras, loading dock. Screen visitors, guests, contractors and delivery personnel and issue passes to authorized individuals. Prepare incident reports and escalate serious issues to manager(s) as per protocol. Provide direction and assistance to building occupants during emergency incidents.

***Schedule:***

***Sat-Sun 12am-12pm*** 

***\\* A dark colored suit is required for this position.***

**Job Requirements:** 

* 3 - 5 years security experience preferred
* Professional appearance, demeanor and strong customer service skills
* Must be flexible to work all shifts including weekends, holidays and overtime as needed
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills
* Veterans with an honorable discharge are strongly encouraged to apply

**License:**

* New York State Security Guard License (Required)
* 8-hour annual Security Officer refresher - current (Required)
* 16-hour on the job training certificate – (Required)
* Fire Guard for Impairment F-01 (Preferred), must be obtained within 2 weeks of employment
* First Aid / AED – CPR certification (Preferred)

**Availability**

QPS maintains operations 24/7/365 and is an “essential business” in the New York area. We work during normal times as well as when other businesses may be closed down. The position requires flexibility and an ability to work whatever schedule and hours are deemed necessary to efficiently accomplish the work and service our clients, which may include working extended hours, weekends, holidays, and/or during emergency situations, such as natural disasters (storms, including but not limited to rain, wind, snow and ice, floods, power outages, fires, earthquakes, etc.), public health emergencies such as the COVID-19 pandemic, government-declared states of emergency, labor strikes, and force majeure events. Accessibility to answer questions by email or phone during off hours in accordance with QPS’ policies is expected. The ability to work this schedule is an essential function of the job.

*Quality Protection Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual* 

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 24 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Night shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a dark colored suit?

License/Certification:

* NYS security guard license (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Patient Coordinator
description:
Position Summary:


Our Patient Coordinators are the backbone of our clinics and have a direct impact on patient experience. They work collaboratively with clinicians and colleagues to provide exceptional patient care and world-class customer service. Responsibilities include greeting and checking-in patients, scheduling appointments, answering incoming phone calls, verifying insurance coverage, obtaining necessary authorization, collecting payments, processing new patients, and helping the clinic maintain optimal performance. Ivy's rewarding and supportive work environment allows accelerated growth and development opportunities for all teammates.
Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

**Patient Coordinator**

Why Choose Ivy?

* **Best Employer:** A prestigious honor to be recognized by Modern Healthcare, signifying excellence in our industry and providing an outstanding workplace culture.
* **Innovative** **Resources & Mentorship:** Access to abundant resources, robust mentorship, and career advice for unparalleled success.
* **Professional Development:** Endless opportunities for career advancement through training programs centered on administrative excellence and leadership development.
* **Exceeding Expectations:** Deliver best-in-class care and witness exceptional patient outcomes.
* **Incentives Galore:** Eligibility for full benefits package beginning within your first month of employment. Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) plans, paid holidays, and bonus incentive opportunities.
* **Exceptional Partnerships:** Collaborate with leaders like Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS) to strive for excellence in patient care.
* **Empowering Values:** Live by values that prioritize teamwork, growth, and serving others.
  

 Position Qualifications:

* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications such as Excel, Word, and Outlook.

Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and organizational need. title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
About Us

Established in 2003, Reddy Care Physical and Occupational Therapy has been featured on the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest growing companies in the country for the past four years and counting. Our physical therapist owned private practice offers stability and growth for every employee. We not only bring talented people together but collaboratively take courses to team build and invest in our employees professional development.

From the very first day, our employees are given personalized onboarding, modern work spaces and the most up to date technology to create an ideal staff/patient interaction. We strive to foster an enthusiastic and productive company culture so our Physical Therapy team can provide effective client care aimed at attaining improved clinical results.

Our vision is to continue to establish outpatient facilities, in-home therapy and courtesy transportation. Our goal is to expand our company to a national platform to revolutionize the way patients access outpatient therapy.

The Opportunity

Reddy Care Physical and Occupational Therapy is hiring a part-time Physical Therapy Aide for our Great Neck, NY outpatient facility. This position is an excellent opportunity for students or recent college graduates looking to expand their knowledge of the physical therapy and healthcare field.

What you will be doing:

Greeting patients when they arrive at the facility

Assisting therapists to administer exercise programs as needed

Interacting with patients to promote a friendly and positive atmosphere

Maintaining the general organization of the clinic.

Prepares hot and cold packs.

Maintains and cleans the treating tables.

Assist with patient flow within the facility as per the direction of the Physical Therapist, Occupational Therapist or Physical Therapist Assistant.

Other duties as assigned.

What you will need:

* Strong interest in the physical therapy or medical field.
* Patient-first mentality.
* Good interpersonal/communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Self-starter.
* High school diploma/GED
* Must be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* May spend long periods of time stooping, kneeling or crouching.
* Students in Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy or Physical Therapist Assistant programs are strongly preferred.

Reddy Care Physical Therapy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

title: Real Estate Asset Management Professional
description:
**Siemens Real Estate**

Our roots are in corporate real estate management for Siemens. We take overall responsibility for all real estate activities. We manage the portfolio, optimize space utilization, coordinate the operation of our real estate, including all real estate related services, and are responsible for leasing, purchases, sales, and construction of real estate assets for Siemens. Our aim is always to support the company's strategy and its businesses as best we can, thus creating long-term value.

**Position Overview:**

The Junior Asset Management Professional role involves coordinating and controlling various corporate real estate activities within the US Siemens Mobility real estate portfolio. The candidate will understand and contribute to the development of real estate standards and guidelines, supporting and monitoring their implementation and continuous improvement. Additionally, the role includes evaluating business cases, handling clarifications, and ensuring quality. The candidate will also support the Senior Asset Manager and the real estate team.

**What your day-to-day will look like:**

* Broad-based real estate knowledge of transactions (deal structuring/positioning), budgeting, and implementation (or can pull in appropriate team members when needed).
* Skills required include but are not limited to:
* Underwriting/due diligence
* Site selection/control
* Entitlements/zoning
* Environmental assessment
* Legal team management
* Scope development and control
* Financial analysis, as well as qualitative site analysis
* Design and construction team selection
* Contract negotiation
* Budgeting and cost management
* Preparation of management schedules
* May not know the answer but knows that there is a question; has project management skills and drives the process; is a self-starter; and possesses good writing skills and ability to communicate graphically via PowerPoint.
* Acts as expert and interface with internal partners regarding Asset Management topics (e.g., Business Principles, Leasing, Building Operations, Space Management, and Real Estate Costs).
* Contributes to the development of real estate standards and guidelines.
* Supports and monitors their implementation and continuous improvement.
* Facilitates the investment application (I-Application) process – the Siemens capital project approval process.
* Evaluates business cases, takes care of clarifications and quality.
* Monitors real estate cost development.
* Coordinates and controls various activities with global or regional scope.
* May have functionally restricted management responsibility for leading one or more operational employees.

**To thrive in this role, you have:**

* 5+ years of experience in commercial real estate.
* Bachelors degree in business, real estate, or similar
* Professional expertise with functional, commercial, and technical knowledge in commercial real estate.
* Ability to integrate analysis, strategy, and implementation.
* Experience interpreting and functionally influencing policy and guidelines in your area of business.
* Experience developing processes and systems to deliver functional objectives.
* Experience planning own work according to targets agreed upon, within a quarterly up to an annual cycle, by integrating resources in a project-driven environment.
* Experience providing functional advice and guidance to colleagues and customers.
* Ability to integrate processes and results from other workflows and disciplines to develop and propose appropriate and effective solutions.
* Deep professional know-how and experience in commercial real estate.
* Solid professional judgment and problem-solving competence.
* Experience improving existing processes and approaches.

**Why you'll love working for Siemens!**

* 11 paid holidays, 18 days of PTO
* 401K - 6% company match
* Freedom and healthy work-life balance– Health, Dental, Vision Insurance, HSA/FSA, Commuter Benefits – starting Day 1!
* We believe that each member of our team is accountable for making decisions, solving problems, and taking actions that contribute to long-term impact and financial success.
* We do the right thing. We stand for green innovations and meaningful solutions with impact on customers, ecosystem partners, society, and environment.
* We are frontrunners in digitalization and building platforms. Therefore, we are hiring ambitious forward-thinkers who want to have a real impact.
* Solve the world's most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
* Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them! Take advantage of our Tuition Reimbursement program, Mentor Programs, and your development through online learning. We operate daily with a growth mindset - that's why Siemens consistently ranks on the **Fortune World's Most Admired Companies** list!
* Employee perks and discounts in addition to our 401k match and generous Paid Time Off

Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without needing current or future employer-sponsored work authorization.

**Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://www.benefitsquickstart.com/siemens/index.html. The base salary range for this position in New York, NY is $107,300 - $125,900.** The salary may be higher or lower depending on the budget and the candidate's experience, knowledge, skills, and qualifications.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $107,300.00 - $125,900.00 per year

Experience:

* Project management: 2 years (Required)
* Financial analysis: 2 years (Required)
* Contract negotiation: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10119 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10119: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Pre-K Teacher in Flushing (DOE)
description:
**About us**

Immanuel Genius believe that preschool school is an important stepping stone along with the path toward independence. Children gain self-confidence in their first school environment when there is respect for their individual differences in temperament, learning styles, and rates of growth. Children learn from experience. They learn from each other. They learn through play. It takes time.

It is important to us that children like school, and that they see it as a place designed for them to be with friends and to take part in interesting and stimulating activities. Young children are active learners. Through a hands-on play approach, children can explore their environment through their senses and experiences. Our inclusive program focuses on the whole child so that his/her social, emotional, physical, and cognitive needs can be met. Our goal is to create an environment where each child grows to love learning and becomes an active learner.

**2024-2025 School Year Position** 

All staff members must go through a screening process upon hire which includes getting fingerprinted by DOE/DOH, medical and education credential review, and completing mandatory trainings.

**Certified Pre-K Teacher** 

* Must have Early Childhood Certification (Initial or Professional)
* 2-3 years of experience preferred, not a must
* Must be have basic knowledge of Pre-K standards and develop his/her curriculum and lesson plans
* Must have good organization, communication, and writing skills
* Proven commitment to quality early childhood education
* Dual Language Preferred

**Study Plan Teacher**

* Minimum of Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education or related fields **AND** enrollment in accredited college or university for obtaining Early Childhood Certification
* Teaching Certification not required upon hire, but must be obtained within 3 years
* Must have good organization, communication and writing skills
* Proven commitment to quality early childhood education

title: Assistant Director of Marketing
description:
**Job Summary**  
The Assistant Director of Marketing will support the strategic marketing efforts across all brands under Vertex Hospitality. This role will assist in developing and executing marketing campaigns, managing brand consistency across all channels, and driving customer engagement to increase brand awareness and sales. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of multi-unit restaurant marketing, with experience in both digital and traditional marketing strategies.

**Responsibilities**  
o Assist the Director of Marketing in developing and implementing comprehensive marketing strategies for all brands within the portfolio.

o Manage and execute marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and in-store promotions.

o Collaborate with operations team leaders to ensure marketing initiatives align with brand identity and business objectives.

o Analyze market trends, customer insights, and competitive landscape to inform marketing strategies.

o Ensure consistent brand messaging and positioning across all marketing channels.

o Oversee the creation and distribution of marketing collateral, including menus, signage, and promotional materials.

o Manage digital marketing initiatives, including website management, SEO/SEM, email marketing, and social media campaigns.

o Track and analyze digital marketing performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.

o Engage with customers on social media platforms, responding to inquiries and fostering positive brand interaction.

o Identify and develop strategic partnerships to enhance brand visibility and drive sales.

o Plan and execute local store marketing (LSM) initiatives and promotional events to increase customer traffic and engagement.

o Collaborate with operations and sales teams to ensure promotional activities are effectively implemented at the unit level.

o Assist in managing the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources for maximum ROI.

o Prepare regular reports on marketing performance, campaign effectiveness, and key metrics for review by the Director of Marketing.

o Monitor and track marketing expenditures to ensure alignment with budgetary goals.

o Provide guidance and support to the marketing team, fostering a collaborative and results-driven environment.

o Assist in training and mentoring junior marketing staff, ensuring they have the skills and knowledge to execute marketing initiatives effectively.

o Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, and finance, to ensure alignment and integration of marketing strategies.

o Additional responsibilities as assigned.

**Qualifications**  
· Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.

· 7+ years of experience in marketing, with at least 3 years in a restaurant or hospitality environment. Previous experience in a supervisory role is required.

· Bilingual: Mandarin (Preferred)

Join our dynamic team as the Director of Marketing and play a key role in shaping our brand's success through innovative marketing strategies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Experience:

* restaurant/hospitality marketing: 2 years (Required)
* Marketing: 5 years (Required)

Language:

* Mandarin (Preferred)

title: Quality Control Inspector 2nd Shift
description:

title: Project Director - Customer Delivery
description:
Project Director, Customer Delivery North America
Nasdaq Fintech division is looking for a Project Director based in our New York City Office. The primary goal of this position is to lead and manage the delivery of major and high-profile implementation projects, from development to implementation. This includes ensuring projects are delivered and completed to a consistently high standard, within budget, and that objectives are met on time. Making sure the projects meet professional project management standards and industry regulations and adhere to the best practices of project management from the Nasdaq’s Delivery Frameworks.
A Project Director must have practical experience as a project manager for large and complex enterprise software initiatives within the capital markets industry.  

Responsibilities
Manage and deliver large scale Capital Markets Projects, with duties including but not limited to:* Plan, lead, manage, and coordinate project tasks using Microsoft Project Plan, resources, deliverables, issues logs, and risks logs.
* Builds strategic relationships with key stakeholders to ensure project is positioned strategically within organization.
* Utilizes and manages resources and coordinates effectively with stakeholders and colleagues.
* Ensures the project plan obligations are met regarding specifications, quality, costs and timeframes.
* Manages multi-faceted and complex IT projects across a matrix environment such as systems integration, systems architecture, new product development or custom systems development.
* Manage and identify risks and opportunities of projects
* Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders
* Builds strategic relationships with clients and key decision-makers and participates in the Steering Committee for projects
* Monitor programs, procedures, and metrics to ensure adherence to defined project management standards, on-time delivery, and overall customer satisfaction


Qualifications and experience* Minimum 10 years in Project Management
* Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or Agile Scrum Master Certification is highly desired. Master’s degree preferred
* Experience and proven track record delivering large scale projects in the Capital Markets Technology sector, ideally across Front, Middle & Back Office, and including Rates, FX and Fixed Income.
* Strong knowledge and experience in the use of the various tools and processes to aid program management
* Track record of superior change management and contractual negotiations within complex project environments
* Strong leadership and management skills and strong customer escalation and resolution capabilities
* Record of leadership in a global, remote, team-oriented environment, working well in a fast-paced environment, and meeting multiple, concurrent deadlines
* Exceptional negotiation and conflict-resolution skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and facilitation skills
* Excellent organizational project and time management skills
* Track record of developing and maintaining relationship with stakeholder of all levels, including senior management and C-Level executives, both internally and externally
* Long experience of effective portfolio and program management. Having been a senior member of program and project management teams
* Solid proficiency in portfolio, program and project management methodologies


Come as You Are
Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
What We Offer
We’re proud to offer a competitive rewards package that is meaningful, recognizes the unique needs of our employees and their families and incentivizes employees for their contribution to Nasdaq’s overall success.
The base pay range for this role is $113,700 - $189,500. In addition to base salary, Nasdaq provides a generous annual bonus/commission (short-term incentive), and equity (long-term incentive), comprehensive benefits, and opportunity for growth. Exact compensation may vary based on several job-related factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to: skill set, experience, education/training, business needs and market demands.
Nasdaq’s programs and rewards are intended to allow our employees to:* Secure Wealth: 401(k) program with 6% employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Program with 15% discount, Student loan repayment program up to $10k, Company paid life and disability plans, Generous paid time off
* Prioritize Health: Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage, Health spending account with employer contribution, Paid flex days to support mental wellbeing, Gym membership discounts
* Care for Family: Hybrid home/office schedule (for most positions), Paid parental leave, Fertility benefits, Paid bereavement leave
* Connect with Community: Company gift matching program, Employee resource groups, Paid volunteer days
* Grow Career: Education Assistance Program, Robust job skills training and Professional development opportunities


For more information, visit Nasdaq Benefits & Rewards Career page.

title: VP, Public Equity Sales
description:
**Company Description**  

Third Bridge is a market-leading investment research firm. We provide integrated solutions for the world’s top investors and business leaders to help them make smarter and faster decisions. No other company in the world provides the same holistic investment offering: our superpower is the combination of human insights and unique investor-led content with a global expert network. We serve over 1,000 investment firms, offering clients 24/7 coverage through our team of 1,300+ employees located across eight offices.

 **Job Description**  

This role will include, but is not limited to:

* Demonstrate Third Bridge’s value proposition across the entire suite of primary research services
* Prospect potential clients who fit the onboarding criteria, developing relationships to better understand their broader research needs
* Oversee the new sales cycle from following up on new business leads to closing deals
* Nurture and track accounts, identify additional opportunities to up-selling and cross-selling during the new account stage
* Successfully transition a new account to account management team including onboarding handoff, introduction to key client stakeholders, etc.


To be successful in this role you will need to have:

* Professional experience selling directly or indirectly in a B2B environment. Experience with public equity firms preferred
* Demonstrable ability to follow up on business leads effectively with excellent networking skills
* Ability to manage an extensive pipeline of prospects in various sales stages simultaneously
* Intellectual curiosity to grow and maintain competitive knowledge & focus
* Strong demonstration of intellect, drive, executive presence, and sales acumen
* Ability to develop and conduct effective presentations with contract decision makers (c-level)
* Proven experience building excellent client relationships, offering value added, insightful and strategic insight into their business
* Excellent organization, written and oral/presentation skills

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree
* 
* Must possess strong communication, negotiating, and time management skills with excellent interpersonal skills
* Aptitude for problem-solving and the ability to determine solutions for customers using a consultative sales approach
* Self-motivated to reach sales goals
* Strong familiarity with Excel and use of databases

  

**Additional Information**  

* Base Salary: $130,000 - $150,000
* Vacation: 15 days (which increases to 20 days after 2 years of service) plus US Holidays - Learning: personal development allowance of $1,150 per year
* Health and wellbeing: a variety of insurance plans, including health coverage by Empire Blue Cross Blue Shield
* Medical Insurance, Dental insurance and Vision plan, plus a personal HSA (Health Saving Account) and Medical FSA (Flexible Spending Account). And also a variety of health and wellbeing events to focus on mental health.
* Future and family: 401K matching up to 5% of your base salary, life insurance, a long-term disability policy dependent care FSA and pet insurance
* Flexibility: work from anywhere for one month per year, 2 annual volunteer days, 2 personal days when life throws you a curveball and 'Summer Fridays'
* Rewards: get points through our colleague-to-colleague recognition programme to spend on hotels, gift cards, donations to charity and more
* Social: weekly optional social gatherings, daily breakfast and snacks, social events
* ESG: CSR, Environment and Diversity & Inclusion (including Women at Third Bridge, Pride and Blkbridge)
* Frontline Innovation: your chance to share your ideas for improvement through Hackathons and other events


The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.


We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

title: Cognitive Health Care Companion
description:
We are urgently looking for a compassionate and experienced Companion Caregiver to join our team, specializing in Dementia and Alzheimer's care. If you have a passion for making a positive impact in the lives of others and possess the skills necessary to provide exceptional care, we would love to hear from you.

**Position Overview:**

As a Companion Caregiver, you will provide essential support and companionship to clients with Dementia and Alzheimer's, helping them maintain their quality of life in the comfort of their homes. Your role will involve offering emotional support, and ensuring the safety and well-being of our clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Offer companionship and engage clients in meaningful activities

Prepare and serve nutritious meals according to dietary requirements

Perform light housekeeping duties to ensure a clean and safe environment

Help with mobility and transportation to appointments and social outings

Monitor and report changes in clients' health status to the care team

Follow individualized care plans tailored to the specific needs of Dementia and Alzheimer's clients

**Qualifications**:

Proven experience as a Companion Caregiver, particularly with Dementia and Alzheimer's patients

Current Covid-19 vaccination is required

Valid driver's license and access to reliable transportation

Flexibility to work varied hours, including weekends

Strong interpersonal skills, patience, and a caring nature

**What We Offer:**

Competitive salary

Flexible work schedule

Opportunities for ongoing training and professional development

A supportive and collaborative team environment

The chance to make a real difference in the lives of those you care for

If you are dedicated, compassionate, and eager to contribute to a team that values quality care, apply today to join us as a Companion Caregiver with specialized experience in Dementia and Alzheimer's care.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Come join our growing community of Care Partners who share this common purpose! At Renewal Memory Partners, we are dedicated to providing holistic, person-centered care to people living with Alzheimer’s and related dementias. Our organization is also committed to providing affirming care to the LGBTQ community.

For all Care Partners of Renewal Memory Partners, we are proud to offer:

* **Community:** We understand that caring for older adults can be isolating at times, and we strive to build community among Care Partners through ongoing support groups, dynamic trainings, and virtual meet-ups.
* **Professional Development:** Through the Renewal Memory Institute, you will have access to best-in-class trainings offered by a multidisciplinary team of experts. You may also have the opportunity to engage in cutting-edge research studies through our partnerships with university and hospital-based teams.
* **Competitive Compensation:** At Renewal Memory Partners, we strive to offer top starting pay, plus a wide range of benefits.
* **A Person-Centered Approach that Honors You:** We celebrate both our clients and our Care Partners as diverse individuals, and actively learn about their hobbies, backgrounds, and interests. We thoughtfully match clients and Care Partners who can build genuine, authentic connections.

**Responsibilities:**

* Providing companionship to older adults and people with chronic health conditions in their homes (e.g., discussing current events, creating artwork, reviewing photo albums).
* Providing compassionate, patient hands-on personal care support for ADLs, including bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and transfers.
* Planning activities outside the home and accompanying clients to keep them engaged with the world (e.g., trips to museums, concerts, plays, or the park).
* Escorting clients to doctors’ appointments.
* Running errands for clients (e.g., grocery shopping, sundries).
* Reminding clients to take their medications.
* Doing light exercise with clients (e.g., helping with stretching routine).
* Assisting clients in preparing meals.
* Performing light housekeeping, such as dusting, tidying, and laundry.

**Qualifications:**

We welcome candidates with diverse backgrounds including the creative arts and healthcare fields. Our employment is selective. Strong candidates possess:

* A valid HHA certificate in New York State
* A passion for caring for individuals with Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias. Prior experience working with this population is valued, but not required.
* An accredited high school diploma, though we prefer candidates with college degrees or those currently attending colleges or graduate schools.
* Deep empathy and patience.
* Flexibility, reliability, and responsiveness.
* Creativity and a positive, open-hearted approach.
* Strong composure under pressure.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to build trust-based relationships with clients and their families.

**Benefits:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* $300 Referral Bonus for Care Partners and Clients
* Daily Pay – We understand your need
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Trainings
* Care Partner of the Month Awards – We celebrate you!
* 401(k) for Senior Care Partners
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* 24/7 Client Services Support
* 24/7 RN Support

**Job Type**: Part-time

title: Temporary School Support Staff
description:
Hello! This job is for a **temporary** role starting asap until November 22nd, 2024 at Transfiguration School Early Childhood Campus, serving students PreK3, PreK4 and K. This school support role will specifically help manage the following needs at our school campus: the organization, food program and cleanliness of the Early Childhood Campus facility. Due to the ages of the young children at this location, the facility requires special attention to ensure that emergency facility issues are attended to, respond to spills/messes*/*accidents, help set-up and administer meal time delivery to students, organize and execute the furniture set-up needs, assist with routine garbage collection as needed, keep restrooms in working and clean order during the school day, and any task assigned by the school staff and campus manager. The ideal candidate is a multi-tasker who understands and is comfortable working in an educational environment with young children. title: Value Stream Director, Needles
description:
Ethicon Inc., a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Value Stream Director, Needles to be located in Raritan, NJ. Consideration will be given to alternate locations in any of our 3 needle making plants.



At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



Are you interested in making a difference in a thriving diverse company culture, that celebrates the uniqueness of our employees and is committed to inclusion Apply today!



The Needles VSL is a critical position that coordinates the E2E process for wire and needle manufacturing. The position works closely with plant leaders, Global Technical Operations (GTO) and all other VSLs to ensure an overall comprehensive needle strategy. This role serves as the leader of a portfolio of products, projects and processes that impact needle design, capacity and manufacturing technologies. Primary responsibility is to optimize supply chain process performance based upon end-to-end thinking, making conscious-profitable tradeoffs, and overall product ownership. Tasks, duties, and responsibilities are listed below.



This position reports to the VP, WC Supply Chain



Key Responsibilities


* Develop and maintain a detailed code level, 10 year capacity model in close collaboration with planning, manufacturing, GTO, process excellence and all other functions.
* Demonstrate strong leadership and influencing skills and be able to drive a team and senior level stakeholders towards a final decision in an environment with high levels of ambiguity, complexity, and risk. Work across functional boundaries, aligning with partners on a roadmap for change, and interacting with all levels in the organization.
* Measure supply chain process performance, collect and analyze data, develop new data analysis methods and techniques to provide deep insights. Build new digital analytical capabilities within the wire manufacturing and needle manufacturing flows. Identify opportunities and develop mitigation strategies where proactive structural changes in E2E supply chain design may be necessary to meet future risks and competitive threats.
* Lead the development and refresh of the Product Strategy Roadmap (PSR) and incorporate the output into the Business Plan, Long Range Financial Plans and Long Range Portfolio Plan. Collaborate with key business partners to identify a broad set of cross-functional needs and build consensus on product, process, and people priorities.
* Drive prioritization efforts within the value stream’s project portfolio. Build business cases for new Life Cycle Management projects and ensure they meet overall strategic objectives. Direct resources and efforts to make improvements.
* Member of the WC Supply Chain Leadership Team.


Accountable for:


* Owning the analysis, planning, execution, improving, and monitoring of Value Stream performance. Leading a cross functional team to develop strategic plan for the value stream.
* Setting targets for, and designing the supply chain network to achieve the strategic capacity plan
* Developing and securing approval/funding for business cases to support growth.
* Partner with Commercial and R&D teams to optimize the needle portfolio.
* Facilitating and creating content to advance value stream management maturity.
* Modeling E2E scenarios and their trade-offs. Providing options and recommendations to senior leaders.
* Connecting the day-to-day performance with the business plan and strategic plan.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------



Qualifications:



Education: Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent University degree required; focused degree specifically in Engineering or related field, MBA or equivalent preferred.



Required:


* A minimum of ten (10) years of relevant professional work experience
* Experience in supply chain or R&D function
* Experience in a regulated industry, preferably MedTech.
* A deep understanding of how end to end supply chains operate
* Experience across demand/production planning, sourcing, manufacturing, inventory management, or delivery to customer
* Requires a strong ability to navigate through ambiguity, and ability to think strategically, innovatively, and creatively to drive positive outcomes.
* Demonstrated results in driving operational excellence across organizations with measurable financial, quality and customer service results
* Strong understanding of the new product introduction process, design control process and process validation in MedTech


Preferred:


* Direct manufacturing experience in a healthcare manufacturing operation


Other:


* May require up to 25% domestic and/or international travel to other locations and sites
* The anticipated base pay range for this position is $142,000 - $244,950/yr.
* This job posting is anticipated to close on 9/25/24. The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.


The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. · Please use the following language:


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits: - Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

  

  

* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

title: Foodservice Account Manager (Midwest Territory)
description:
Job Summary
IFF is looking for our next Foodservice Account Manager based in the Chicago territory, to become part of our industry-leading Business Development team. Are you passionate about building relationships and programs that help drive growth for industry leading Foodservice customers? Would you love to work for a company that is transforming the everyday? If the answer is yes, this may be your next career step! As a Foodservice Account Manager, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the continued growth of IFF by driving revenue, generating strategies, and serving as a trusted business partner to our Foodservice customers. The individual we are seeking will develop, implement & execute Sales Strategy with customers in order to grow profitable sales and support overall business objectives of the corporation.  

  

RESPONSIBILITIES:  

  

This person will strategically take ownership, develop, and expand a current territory, primarily based in the Chicago/Midwest territory.  

Employ a developmental selling approach with the goal of being a primary innovation partner for priority accounts.  

Identify, evaluate, and develop strategic partnerships to help grow foodservice.  

Analyze customer market challenges to determine and drive value proposition.  

Position IFF as a strategic trusted partner by co-creating winning value propositions that satisfy customer needs.  

Excellent interpersonal, communication and problem-solving skills with the ability to lead and coordinate activities with internal support team and customers. Inspires others by acting as a leading example.  

Confident, dynamic and enthusiastic professional with ability to generate trust by delivering on commitments.* 6-8+ years’ experience in foodservice, food ingredient, flavor, seasoning or food processing industry.
* Must have hands-on experience and a track record of success, selling to national restaurant operator chains.
* Ideal candidate will have some existing relationships with customer base that will benefit the business.
* Strong ability to pioneer high level relationships, translating customer priorities into product solutions.
* Success with major National Accounts, their processors and distribution channels. Understanding of the entire system from concept to in store implementation.
* Ability to seek out and manage strategic partnerships.
* Ideal candidate will have the desired experience to step into the role and quickly impact the organization.
* B.S. degree in business administration, marketing, food science or related field.


We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Company:  
Bellona USA is a flourishing furniture manufacturer and online retailer that combines the latest trends and cutting-edge technology to produce functional and fashionable home furnishing items. Our trusted brand has widely known roots in Europe, Africa, and the Middle East, with a successful expansion into the US furniture market. We value ethical and encouraging work environments, sustainable industry practices, and maintaining thriving customer relations through excellent service, quality products, and full transparency at every step.

Job Description:  
We are looking for a Customer Service Specialist to join our growing team in Paterson, New Jersey to help facilitate positive customer experiences. In this role, you will be the face and voice that customers interact with for inquiries, issues, and general information regarding their orders from the time of placement through after-sales services. You will coordinate communications between customers, sales representatives, and other departments accordingly and confirm order accuracy at every stage. The ideal candidate has a passion for helping people, is highly detail and task-oriented, and can interact with customers in a friendly and professional manner on a daily basis. This is an in-person role, Monday through Friday, 9 AM – 5.30 PM.

Responsibilities:  
- Speak with customers in a professional and friendly manner regarding all aspects of their orders.  
- Answer customer service emails and phone calls, take messages, address any issues, and direct customers to the proper departments regarding their inquiries.  
- Work on customer shipments and handle them professionally and efficiently.  
- Follow through on order fulfillment and shipments by confirming customer orders, sending order forms and paperwork to accounting, keeping track of customer invoices, and following up with shipment confirmation once orders are processed.  
- Verify customer orders by confirming that all items, parts, colors, and fabric choices are correct and included in orders before shipment.  
- Facilitate communications regarding customer orders between warehouse, logistics, and accounting departments.  
- Update customers on shipping times and freight costs.  
- Take stock of inventories and stay up to date on item availability.  
- Become knowledgeable about Bellona USA products.  
- Coordinate communications between sales representatives and customers regarding order updates and any issues.  
- Be the point of contact for sales representatives and maintain up-to-date knowledge on sales territories and orders.

Qualifications:  
- Ability to work schedule of Monday-Friday 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM

- Strong background in customer service in 3 years including excellent communication skills, written, verbal, and listening, prompt friendly service, and excellent follow-through

- Bilingual in Spanish strongly preferred

- Primary customer contact responsible for a high volume of incoming telephone calls

- Strong Phone Etiquette with a professional attitude

- People-oriented, Detail oriented, Proactive in problem-solving

- Ability to work well with others in a team environment

- Ability to adapt and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment

- Knowledge of FISHBOWL

Benefits:  
- Salary: $37,000 - $45,000  
- PTO: Yes  
- Health insurance: Yes  
- Dental and vision: Yes  
- 401K: Yes

Contact:  
- Please send your resume to info@bellonausa.com

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $37,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Shift:

* Day shift

Work Location: In person

title: Social Worker
company: New York Center for Interpersonal Development
description:
Position Title: Social Worker  
Program: NYCID Mental Health programs  
Site: Staten Island  
Reports To: NYCID Senior Director of Community Development  
Salary Range: Commensurate with experience  
New York Center for Interpersonal Development (NYCID)  
We believe in building community and nurturing personal growth. We improve lives through communication, conflict  
management, social-emotional learning, and youth and workforce development. Through our core values of Collaboration,  
Accountability, Recognition, and Resilience, NYCID works to help people develop skills which move New York City  
toward the goal of being a more civil and economically stable place for all.

Minimum Qualifications:  
This funder requires that candidates possess a Master’s Degree in Social Work. or Mental  
Health Counselor is preferred.

NYCID is seeking a full time Social Worker  
Workers and Licensed Mental Health Clinicians.  
Seeking an MSW with at least 2 years’ experience in the field.  
● Social Worker who has worked in various settings such as preventative services, clinic treatment, case  
management, and/or school setting  
● experience with crisis interventions and de-escalation services  
● experience with treating those with high-risk behaviors such as self-injurious, suicidal ideations and gestures.  
● experience with eclectic styles of treatment for anxiety, depression, and various other diagnosis  
● experience in intake process, psychosocial assessments, and treatment planning  
● experience in collaboration with other agencies and referring families to most appropriate level of care  
Will report to Tara Howard, LCSWR, SIFI  
The candidate should be familiar with all or a combination of the following:  
● Commitment to demonstrating NYCID’s core values of: Collaboration, Accountability, Recognition and  
Resiliency  
● Respect for, sensitivity towards as well as knowledge and understanding of the different cultures and traditions in  
the community  
● Knowledge of the community and the external services and service agencies

● Strong interpersonal skills, business sense, and professionalism to communicate with all levels of management,  
NYCID staff, school staff, and outside resources  
● Strong verbal communication skills and written communication skills  
● Excellent preparation, organizational, and planning skills  
● Knowledge of youth development principles  
● Proficiency in listening, encouraging, and providing feedback to students  
● Excellent preparation, organizational, and planning skills  
● Adept ability to motivate, engage and develop rapport quickly with children and young adults  
Responsibilities:  
The candidate should be familiar with all or a combination of the following. Duties and responsibilities include  
but are not limited to:  
● NYCID is actively participating in DEI initiatives. All gained knowledge will be incorporated into programming,  
hiring, and collaborative efforts with stakeholders  
● Complete all NYCID system-wide reporting and paperwork requirements in a timely manner, including payroll  
materials, departmental goals and work plans, budget preparation, tracking materials, employment paperwork, and  
others as needed  
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  
● Adept at putting ideas into practice when developing programs tailored to student, parent and community needs  
● Ability to maintain the highest degree of confidentiality, integrity, and professionalism  
● Ability to embrace and live NYCID’s Core Values: Collaboration, Accountability, Recognition, and Resilience

Additional Notes:

NYCID is an Equal Opportunity employer/program. NYCID is committed to creating an inclusive, diverse, and anti-racist  
environment . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity,  
religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran  
status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Description:

Celebrating our 50th anniversary this year, TRI-K Industries, Inc. has been a leading provider of sustainable specialty ingredients since 1974. Our mission is to inspire consumer brands and enable their success by delivering differentiating technologies, prioritizing product efficacy and sustainability. Motivated by our core values of Empathy, Curiosity, and Excellence, our customers and partners get the attention, agility, and innovation they need to be successful in the marketplace. We specialize in proteins, including amino acids and natural peptides, modern preservatives, and multi-active, multi-functional ingredient solutions. Our in-house development team continually pioneers new materials, differentiating our customers’ brands. We strive to amplify consumers’ voices within our organization, ensuring we bring relevant offerings and innovations to the market.

 **Summary:** This role provides administrative support to the People Energy Team and the Executive Team as required. This role coordinates employee engagement events and travel; oversees meeting arrangements and assists with general office duties, the resolution of office maintenance issues, and special projects.


Requirements: **Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.**

* Prepares and manages correspondence, maintains files, screens and documents calls.
* Assists with general office duties such as copying, scanning, and preparing mailings.
* Schedules meetings and appointments, and arranges for business meals, on and off site.
* Assists with arrangements, including travel, for conferences, holiday events, sales, and management meetings.
* Performs special projects, prepares presentation books for quarterly meetings, compiles data and prepares documentation as requested.
* Assists in planning and executing employee engagement activities.
* Works hand in hand with facility safety representative to ensure scheduled inspections and maintain all records for fire, alarm & systems inspections.
* Oversees equipment maintenance schedules and proactively ensures upkeep of equipment on a timely basis in line with maintenance schedules.
* Monitoring/budgeting the expenses pertaining to office facility and coordinating any upgrades needed.
* Purchases supplies for the office
* Update TRI-K electronic board to welcome new employees and special guests
* Prepares and submits monthly invoicing, including Benefits, Supplies, Travel, and Expenses.
* Act as SME for Concur and assist with travel planning and expense report uploading.
* Ownership of aesthetics for reception area/lobby area
* Mail distribution, shipping and receiving for remote team members and supplies for other TRI-K sites.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.
* Must be able to work onsite 5 days a week

**Education/Experience:**

* Associate or bachelor's degree in a related field required.
* At least two year's related experience required.

***Required Skills/Abilities:***

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

**Work Environment:**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Physical Demands:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms and climb or balance. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision and Ability to adjust focus.


We offer a competitive compensation package including:

* Medical
* Dental
* 401 (K)
* Vision
* Paid Time Off
* Life Insurance
* In addition to other programs and plans


TRI-K Industries is an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate and value diversity in our workforce. Hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
