* Collaborate with HR leadership to identify technical needs and recommend advanced HRIS and Workforce Analytics solutions.
* Direct and manage responses to HRIS and Workforce Analytics initiatives, ensuring compliance with timelines and providing efficient feedback on system enhancements and technical improvements.
* Research and resolve complex HRMS and Workforce Analytics issues, perform scheduled activities, and recommend solutions or alternative methods to meet technical requirements.
* Select, hire, train, and supervise HRIS and Workforce Analytics staff; provide ongoing technical feedback and guidance, initiate disciplinary actions, conduct performance appraisals, and recommend promotions and raises.
* Respond to HRIS and Workforce Analytics issues, investigate and coordinate with HR staff and MIS or external vendors to ensure timely resolution of complex technical problems.
* Lead technical training and support for HR personnel related to PeopleSoft queries, Workforce Analytics, and other system inquiries.
* Provide technical leadership in user acceptance testing (UAT) for PeopleSoft patches and upgrades, plan design changes, and HR-specific functions, including data extraction for test scripts.

**We require:**

* ***Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Computer Science, Information Technology Management, Data Science, or a related technical field required. (Master’s degree preferred)***
* **Minimum of 10 years of related technical experience, plus 3 years in a managerial capacity.**
* **Minimum of 8 years of experience implementing an HCM system.**
* Experience with HCM, HR, and advanced analytics platforms.
* Experience partnering with key stakeholders to develop multi-year HR technology and analytics strategies.
* In-depth knowledge of PeopleSoft, PS Query, Power BI, and data management technologies.
* Minimum of 5 years of advance SQL, Python, or R programming coding language
* Working knowledge of Kronos, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word), BI Publishing, and data lake technologies.

**Salary: $185,000 – $205,000**/**year** based on experience. Excellent benefits package offered!

For immediate consideration, **please forward resume to resumes@maimo.org**

Maimonides Medical Center (MMC) is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard for race, creed (religion), color, sex, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, predisposing genetic characteristic, marital status or domestic violence victim status, citizenship status, or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. MMC is committed to following the requirements of the New York State Human Rights Law with regard to non-discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $185,000.00 - $205,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Gutter guard sales technician
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

Scalable commission structure enabling $120,000-$150,000 earning potential.

We are seeking a dedicated Gutter Guard (gutter filter) Sales Technician to join our team. The gutter guard sales technician will respond to leads, visit customers at home, and work with them to put in place gutter protection solution specific to their home.

\\*Responsibilities\\*

- Timely respond to leads

- Visit with customers

- Follow up on estimates

- Close on business

- Cultivate additional leads (less than 10% of work effort)

\\*Qualifications\\*

- Experience with pest control sales

- Ability to effectively communicate with clients, explain to them the benefits of our gutter guard aolutions

- Willingness to learn and grow in the gutter installation industry, including experimenting with various sales approaches

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: From $60,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Pest control sales: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License and Transportation (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Receptionist
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Receptionist to join our team. As the first point of contact for clients, the successful candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service and ensuring a seamless experience for all visitors and callers. This role plays a vital part in maintaining the overall appearance and ambiance of our office, while also supporting the administrative team.

\\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\*

- Greet and assist visitors and callers in a professional and courteous manner, providing information about our services and policies.

- Manage and coordinate events, meetings, and appointments, ensuring all details are accurate and timely.

- Utilize computerized systems to update records, process transactions, and maintain accurate records.

- Provide administrative support to the team, including project coordination, data entry, and other tasks as required.

- Maintain a clean and organized office space, ensuring that all areas are tidy and presentable.

- Manage incoming and outgoing mail and packages, and distribute mail and packages to the appropriate personnel.

- Demonstrate excellent phone etiquette and handle incoming calls with professionalism and efficiency.

- Offer personal assistant services to senior management and other staff members as needed.

- Monitor and maintain office supplies, ensuring that the office is fully stocked and prepared for daily operations.

- Transcribe and maintain records of meetings, phone calls, and other events as required.

- Collaborate with the administrative team to ensure that all office operations run smoothly and efficiently.

\\*\\*Experience:\\*\\*

- Previous experience as a receptionist or administrative assistant in a similar office environment.

- Familiarity with medical receptionist duties and procedures is an asset.

- Experience with event planning and project coordination is highly desirable.

- Experience working in real estate or a related field is an asset.

- Strong knowledge of office management principles and practices.

- Excellent organizational and communication skills.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.

- Proficiency in computerized systems and office software applications.

We offer a dynamic and supportive work environment, with opportunities for professional growth and development. If you are a detail-oriented and customer-focused individual with a passion for delivering exceptional service, we encourage you to apply for this exciting role.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.23 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Township of Jackson, NJ 08527 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Township of Jackson, NJ 08527: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: School of Public Health -Health Behavior, Society & Policy - Open Rank Faculty Positions
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** School of Public Health -Health Behavior, Society & Policy - Open Rank Faculty Positions
  

**Department** SPH-Health Systems
  

**Salary** Commensurate With Experience
  

**Posting Summary**
The Rutgers School of Public Health invites applications for multiple open-rank tenure/tenure-track and clinical faculty positions across our four departments: Biostatistics and Epidemiology; Environmental and Occupational Health and Justice; Health Behavior, Society, and Policy; and Urban-Global Public Health.  

  

We are a leading school of public health dedicated to advancing the well-being of diverse populations through cutting-edge research, education, and community engagement, where our commitment to excellence is demonstrated across six Areas of Excellence:  

  

* Environmental Justice
* LGBTQ+ Health
* Mental Health & Substance Abuse
* Modern Biostatistical & Epidemiological Methods
* Sexual, Reproductive, Maternal and Child Health
* Violence Prevention

  

Our faculty are engaged in cutting-edge research, innovative teaching, and impactful community service in several disciplines within these areas, including but not limited to: aging, causal inference methods, climate change, clinical trial designs, sustainability, global and migrant health, infectious and chronic disease epidemiology, perinatal health, pharmacoepidemiology, public health nutrition, population mental health, social and commercial determinants of health, statistical learning methods, and substance use.  

  

We are particularly interested in candidates whose works align with any of these disciplines or, more broadly, with any of our six Areas of Excellence.  

  

Successful applicants will be expected to develop and sustain an extramurally funded research program, contribute to our teaching mission, mentor MPH and doctoral students, and actively engage with the communities we serve.  


  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Posting Number** 24FA0697
  

**Posting Open Date** 07/01/2024
  

**Posting Close Date** 01/31/2025
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
We offer an attractive recruitment package that includes a competitive salary and start-up funds.  

  

Candidates must hold a doctoral degree (PhD or equivalent) and demonstrate a strong record of scholarship as appropriate for their rank.  

Tenure/tenure-track applicants must have a history of successful extramural funding as independent researchers.  

  

Review of applications will occur on a rolling basis.
  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
  

**Overview**
**Why Rutgers School of Public Health?**
Our mission is to advance health and well-being and prevent disease locally, nationally, and globally by preparing students as public health leaders, scholars, and practitioners; conducting public health research and scholarship; engaging collaboratively with communities; and advocating for policies, programs, and services with a focus on equity and social justice.
At **Rutgers School of Public Health**, you will find a collaborative environment with a diverse range of experts and resources across the school, **Rutgers Health**, and the wider **Rutgers University** community.  

Appointments will be made in an appropriate department within the School of Public Health, which has locations in Newark and New Brunswick. We offer multiple master’s and doctoral degrees, dual-degree, certificate, and articulated BA/BS-MPH degree programs. We also offer robust online and global programming, with partnerships in China, Greece, Italy, and Tanzania. Under the leadership of Dean Perry N. Halkitis, the CEPH-accredited Rutgers School of Public Health continues to pursue dynamic and transformative growth.  

Join us in our mission to advance public health and make a meaningful impact on communities locally and globally.
  

**Statement**
Rutgers School of Public Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from individuals who contribute to the diversity of our academic community.
  

Posting Details
**Special Instructions to Applicants**
To apply, please submit:* Cover letter addressing candidate’s qualifications
* Research statement, if applicable
* Teaching philosophy statement
* Commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, justice, and antiracism statement
* Curriculum vitae (with clear indication of extramural grants, role on these grants, funding source and amount)

* Names of three (3) references
  

  

**Quick Link to Posting** https://jobs.rutgers.edu/postings/230943
  

**Campus** Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS)
  

**Home Location Campus** Piscataway (RBHS)
  

**City** Piscataway
  

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**
  

Pre-employment Screenings
All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.
